column1: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ / sahamūrān anu daha kravya adaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ //
column2: Thou, Agni, ever slayest Yātudhānas, the fiends have never con- quered thee in battles. Consume thou from the root the flesh-devourers, let none of them escape thy heavenly weapon

column1: samāhara jātavedaḥ yat dhṛtam yat parābhṛtam / gātrāṇi asya vardhantām aṃśuḥ iva ā pyāyatām ayam /
column2: Collect, O Jātavedas, what hath been removed and borne away. Let this man's members grow, let him swell like the tendril of a plant.

column1: somasya iva jātavedaḥ aṃśuḥ ā pyāyatām ayam / agne virapśinam medhyam a yakṣmam kṛṇu jīvatu //
column2: Like as the Soma's tendril, thus, O Jātavedas let him swell, Let him live, Agni I Make him fat, free from consumption, full of sap.

column1: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ piśāca jambhanīḥ / tāḥ tvam juṣasva prati ca enāḥ gṛhāṇa jātavedaḥ /
column2: Here, Agni, is the fuel, here are logs that crush Pisāchas down. O Jātavedas, willingly accept them and be pleased therewith.

column1: tārṣṭā aghīḥ agne samidhaḥ prati gṛhṇāhi arciṣā / jahātu kravyād rūpam yaḥ asya māṃsam jihīrṣati //
column2: Accept, O Agni, with thy flame the billets of Tārshtāgha wood. Let the flesh-eater who would take the flesh of this man lose his form.

column1: āvataḥ te āvataḥ parāvataḥ te āvataḥ / iha eva bhava mā nu gāḥ mā pūrvān anu gāḥ pitṝn asum badhnāmi te dṛḍham //
column2: From thy vicinity I call, from near, from far, from night at hand. Stay here: depart not: follow not the Fathers of the olden time. I bind thy vital spirit fast.

column1: yat tvā abhiceruḥ puruṣaḥ svaḥ yat araṇaḥ janaḥ / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te /
column2: If any man, a stranger or akin, hath cast a spell on thee, I with my voice to thee declare thy freedom and release there- from.

column1: yat dudrohitha śepiṣe striyai puṃse acittyā / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te / yat enasaḥ mātṛ kṛtāt śeṣe pitṛ kṛtāt ca yat / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te / yat te mātā yat te pitā jamiḥ bhrātā ca sarjataḥ / pratyak sevasva bheṣajam jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā /
column2: If thou art lying there because of mother's or of father's sin, I with my voice declare to thee thy freedom and release there- from. Accept the healing medicine, the balm thy mother and thy sire, Thy sister and thy brother bring. I make thee live through lengthened years.

column1: iha edhi puruṣa sarveṇa manasā saha / dūtau yamasya mānu gāḥ adhi jīva purā ihi //
column2: O man, stay here among us; stay with all thy spirit: follow not Yama's two messengers. Approach the castles where the living dwell.

column1: anuhūtaḥ punar ehi vidvān udayanam pathaḥ / ārohaṇam ākramaṇam jīvataḥ jīvataḥ ayanam //
column2: Come back as thou art called to come, knowing the outlet of the path, And the Approach and its ascent, the way of every living man.

column1: mā bibheḥ na mariṣyasi jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā / niḥ avocam aham yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ aṅga jvaram tava /
column2: Be not alarmed: thou wilt not die. I give thee lengthened years of life. Forth from thy members have I charmed Decline that caused the fever there.

column1: aṅga bhedaḥ aṅga jvaraḥ yaḥ ca te hṛdaya āmayaḥ / yakṣmaḥ śyenaḥ iva prāpaptat vacā sāḍhaḥ parastarām /
column2: Gone is the pain that racked thee, gone thy fever, gone thy heart's disease. Consumption, conquered by my voice, hath, like a hawk, fled far away.

column1: ṛṣī bodha pratībodhau asvapnaḥ yaḥ ca jāgṛviḥ / tau te prāṇasya goptārau divā naktam ca jāgṛtām /
column2: Two sages, Sense and Vigilance, the sleepless and the watchful one, These, the protectors of thy life, shall be awake both day and night.

column1: ayam agniḥ upasadyaḥ iha sūryaḥ ud etu te / udehi mṛtyoḥ gambhīrāt kṛṣṇāt cit tamasaḥ pari /
column2: This Agni must be waited on. Here let the Sun mount up for thee. Rise from deep death and come away, yea, from black darkness rise thou up!

column1: namaḥ yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave namaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ uta ye nayanti / utpāraṇasya yaḥ veda tam agnim puras dadhe asmai ariṣṭatātaye /
column2: Homage be paid to Yama, to Mrityu, and to the Fathers, and to those who guide us! I honour first, for this man's preservation, that Agni who well knoweth how to save him.

column1: aitu prāṇaḥ aitu manaḥ aitu cakṣuḥ atho balam / śarīram asya sam vidām tat padbhyām prati tiṣṭhatu //
column2: Let breath and mind return to him, let sight and vigour come again Let all his body be restored and firmly stand upon its feet.

column1: prāṇena agne cakṣuṣā sam sṛja imam sam īraya tanvā sam balena / vettha amṛtasya mā nu gāt mā nu bhūmi gṛhaḥ bhuvat /
column2: Provide this man with breath and sight, O Agni, and with his body and his strength unite him. Thou knowest Amrit: let him not go hence, nor dwell in house of clay.

column1: mā te prāṇaḥ upa dasat mā u apānaḥ api dhāyi te / sūryaḥ tvā adhipatiḥ mṛtyoḥ udāyacchatu raśmibhiḥ /
column2: Let not thine inward breathing fail, let not thine outward breath be lost. Let Sūrya who is Lord Supreme raise thee from death with beams of light.

column1: iyam antar vadati jihvā baddhā paniṣpadā / tvayā yakṣmam niḥ avocam śatam ropīḥ ca takmanaḥ /
column2: Tied, tremulously moving, here the tongue is speaking in the mouth. With thee I charmed Decline away and Fever's hundred ago- nies.

column1: ayam lokaḥ priyatamaḥ devānām aparājitaḥ / yasmai tvam iha mṛtyave diṣṭaḥ puruṣa jajñiṣe / sa ca tvā anu hvayāmasi mā purā jarasaḥ mṛthāḥ // yām te cakruḥ āme pātre yām cakruḥ miśra dhānye / āme māṃse kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
column2: This living world, unconquered of the Gods, is most beloved of all. To whatsoever death thou wast destined when thou wast born,. O man, This death and we call after thee. Die not before decrepit age!

column1: doṣaḥ gāya bṛhat gāya dyumat dhehi / ātharvaṇaḥ stuhi devam savitāram /
column2: Sing, Atharvana, at eve, sing loudly, bring a splendid present: hymn God Savitar with praises.

column1: tam u stuhi yaḥ antar sindhau sūnuḥ / satyasya yuvānam adrogha vācam su śevam /
column2: Yea, praise him whose home is in the river, Son of Truth, the youthful, gracious friend whose word is guileless.

column1: sa ghā naḥ devaḥ savitā sāviṣat amṛtāni bhūri / ubhe suṣṭutī sugātave /
column2: Savitar our God shall send us many everlasting treasures, that both paths may well be travelled.

column1: indrāya somam ṛtvijaḥ sunota ca dhāvata / stotuḥ yaḥ vacaḥ śṛṇavat dhavam ca me /
column2: For Indra, ministering priests! run ye and press the Soma juice, That he may hear his praiser's word, and this my call.

column1: ā yam viśanti indavaḥ vayaḥ na vṛkṣam andhasaḥ / virapśin vi mṛdhaḥ jahi rakṣasvinīḥ /
column2: Thou into whom the drops find way as sap pours life into a tree, Drive off in thine abundant might our demon foes.

column1: sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe / yuvā jeta īśānaḥ sa puruṣṭutaḥ /
column2: For Indra, thunder-armed, who drinks the Soma press the Soma out: He, youthful, conqueror, and Lord is praised by all.

column1: pātam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ / apām napāt sindhavaḥ sapta pātana pātu naḥ viṣṇuḥ uta dyauḥ /
column2: Guard us the Maruts! Guard us well, O Indra, Piishan, Aditi. Guard us, O Waters' Child, and Rivers Seven. May Vishnu guard us, and the Sky.

column1: pātām naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī abhiṣṭaye pātu grāvā pātu somaḥ naḥ aṃhasaḥ / pātu naḥ devī subhagā sarasvatī pātu agniḥ śivā ye asya pāyavaḥ /
column2: May Heaven and Earth take care of us for victory, may Pressing- Stone and Soma save us from distress. Sarasvati, auspicious Goddess, guard us well: preserve us Agni and his kind protecting powers.

column1: pātām naḥ deva aśvinā śubhaḥ patī uṣāsānakta uta naḥ uruṣyatām / apām napāt abhihrutī gayasya cit deva tvaṣṭar vardhaya sarvatātaye /
column2: Preserve us both the Asvins, Gods and Lords of Light, and let the Dawns and Night bring us deliverance. The Waters' Child protect our house from every harm. Do thou, God Tvashtar, make us strong for health and wealth.

column1: tvaṣṭā me daivyam vacaḥ parjanyaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ / putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ aditiḥ nu pātu naḥ duṣṭaram trāyamāṇam sahaḥ //
column2: May Tvashtar, Brāhmanaspati, Parjanya hear my holy prayer. May Aditi with all her sons, the brothers, guard us, invincible, protecting power.

column1: aṃśaḥ bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ / apa tasya dveṣaḥ gamet abhihrutaḥ yāvayat śatrum antitam /
column2: May Ansa, Bhaga, Varuna, and Mitra, Aryaman, Aditi, and Maruts guard us. May we be freed from that oppressor's hatred. May he keep off that foeman who is near us.

column1: dhiye sam aśvinā prāvatam naḥ uruṣyāḥ naḥ urujman aprayuchan / dyauḥ pitar yāvaya duchunā yā /
column2: May both the Asvins further our devotion. With ceaseless care deliver us, Wide-Ranger! O Father Heaven, keep from us all misfortunes.

column1: ud enam uttaram naya agne ghṛtena āhuta / sam enam varcasā sṛja prajayā ca bahum kṛdhi //
column2: Agni, adored with sacred oil, lift up this man to high estate. Endow him with full store of strength and make him rich in progeny.

column1: indra imam prataram kṛdhi sajātānām asat vaśī / rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam sṛja jīvātave jarase naya //
column2: Advance him, Indra! Let him be ruler of all akin to him. Grant him sufficiency of wealth: guide him to life and length of days.

column1: yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe tam agne vardhaya tvam / tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat ayam ca brahmaṇas patiḥ /
column2: Prosper this man, O Agni, in whose house we offer sacrifice. May Soma bless him, and the God here present, Brāhmanaspati.

column1: yaḥ asmān brahmaṇas pate a devaḥ abhimanyate / sarvam tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate /
column2: The godless man whoever plots against us, Brāhmanaspati, Thou shalt give up as prey to me the worshipper who pour the juice.

column1: yaḥ naḥ soma su śaṃsinaḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ ādideśati / vajreṇa asya mukhe jahi sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati //
column2: If, Soma, any spiteful man hath aimed at us whose thoughts are kind, Smite with thy bolt upon his face: he, crushed to pieces, vani- sheth.

column1: yaḥ naḥ soma abhidāsati sanābhiḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ / apa tasya balam tira mahī iva dyauḥ vadhatmanā /
column2: Soma, whoever troubleth us, be he a stranger or akin, Deprive him of the strength he hath: slay him thy-self like mighty Dyaus!

column1: yena soma aditiḥ pathā mitrāḥ vā yanti adruhaḥ / tena naḥ avasā gahi // yena soma sāhantyā asurān randhayāsi naḥ / tena naḥ adhi vocata / yena devāḥ asurāṇām ojāṃsi avṛṇīdhvam / tena naḥ śarma yacchata /
column2: Sinless may we ascend, for weal, the vessel, rowed with good oars, divine, that never leaketh, Earth, our strong guard, incomparable Heaven, Aditi wisely lead- ing, well protecting.

column1: yathā vṛkṣam libujā samantam pariṣasvaje / eva pari svajasva mām yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ / yathā suparṇaḥ prapatan pakṣau nihanti bhūmyām / eva ni hanmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
column2: Like as the creeper throws, her arms on every side around the tree, So hold thou me in thine embrace that thou mayst be in love with me, my darling, never to depart. As, when he mounts, the eagle strikes his pinions downward on the earth, So do I strike thy spirit down that thou mayst be in love with me, my darling, never to depart.

column1: yathā ime dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas paryeti sūryaḥ / eva pari emi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
column2: As in his rapid course the Sun encompasses the heaven and: earth, So do I compass round thy mind that thou mayst be in love with. me, my darling, never to depart.

column1: vāñcha me tanvam pādau vāñcha akṣyau vāñcha sakthyau / akṣyau vṛṣaṇyantyāḥ keśāḥ mām te kāmena śuṣyantu //
column2: Desire my body, love my feet, love thou mine eyes, and love my legs. Let both thine eyes and hair, fond girl! be dried and parched. through love of me.

column1: mama tvā doṣaṇi śriṣam kṛṇomi hṛdaya śriṣam / yathā mama kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi //
column2: I make thee hang upon mine arm, I make thee lie upon my heart. Thou yieldest to my wish, that thou mayst be submissive to my will.

column1: yāsām nābhiḥ ārehaṇam hṛdi saṃvananam kṛtam gāvaḥ ghṛtasya mātaraḥ amūm sam vānayantu me //
column2: May they whose kisses are a bond, a love-charm laid within the heart, Mothers of butter, may the cows incline that maid to love of me.

column1: pṛthivyai śrotrāya vanaspatibhyaḥ agnaye adhipataye svāhā /
column2: All hail for hearing to the Earth, to Trees, to Agni, sovran Lord!

column1: prāṇāya antarikṣāya vayobhyaḥ vāyave adhipataye svāhā //
column2: All hail for breath to Air, for power to life to Vāyu, sovran Lord!

column1: dive cakṣuṣe nakṣatrebhyaḥ sūryāya adhipataye svāhā /
column2: All hail for vision to the Stars, to Heaven, to Sūrya, sovran Lord!

column1: śamīm aśvatthe ārūḍhaḥ tatra puṃsuvanam kṛtam / tat vai putrasya vedanam tat strīṣu ā bharāmasi // puṃsi vai retaḥ bhavati tat striyām anu sicyate / tat vai putrasya vedanam tat prajāpatiḥ abravīt // prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ sinīvālī acīkḷpat / straiṣūyam anyatra dadhat pumāṃsam u dadhat iha /
column2: The father sows the genial seed, the woman tends and fosters it. This is the finding of a son: thus hath Prajāpati declared. Prajāpati, Anumati, Sinivāli have ordered it. Elsewhere may he effect the birth of maids, but here prepare a boy.

column1: pari dyām iva sūryaḥ ahīnām janima agamam / rātrī jagat iva anyat dhaṃsāt tena te vāraye viṣam /
column2: I, As the Sun goes round the heaven, have travelled round the Serpents' race. I ward thy poison off, as Night parts all else living from the Sun.

column1: yat brahmabhiḥ yat ṛṣibhiḥ yat devaiḥ viditam purā / yat bhūtam bhavyam āsanvat tena te vāraye viṣam /
column2: With this, discovered in the days of old by Brāhmans, Rishis, Gods, With this I ward thy poison off, thou Biter! formed and form- ing now.

column1: madhvā pṛñce nadyaḥ parvatāḥ girayaḥ madhu / madhu paruṣṇī śīpālā śam āsne astu śam hṛde /
column2: With mead I mingle flowing streams: the hills and mountains shall be mead. Parushni and Sipālā mead. May it be well with mouth and heart.

column1: namaḥ deva vadhebhyaḥ namaḥ rāja vadhebhyaḥ / atho ye viśyānām vadhāḥ tebhyaḥ mṛtyo namaḥ astu te /
column2: Worship to weapons of the Gods! worship to weapons of the Kings! Then worship to the people's arms! worship, O Death, be paid to thee!

column1: namaḥ te adhivākāya parāvākāya te namaḥ / sumatyai mṛtyo te namaḥ durmatyai te idam namaḥ //
column2: Let worship be to thy defence and to thine accusation paid. Death! be this worship paid to thy good-will and thy malevo- lence!

column1: namaḥ te yātudhānebhyaḥ namaḥ te bheṣajebhyaḥ / namaḥ te mṛtyo mūlebhyaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ idam namaḥ /
column2: Worship to thy physicians, to thy sorcerers be worship paid! Death! let this reverence be done unto thy Brāhmans and thy roots.

column1: asthi sraṃsam paru sraṃsam āsthitam hṛdaya āmayam / balāsam sarvam nāśaya aṅgeṣṭhāḥ yaḥ ca parvasu //
column2: Remove thou all Decline that lurks within the members and the joints, The firmly-settled heart-disease that racks the bones and rends the limbs.

column1: niḥ balāsam balāsinaḥ kṣiṇomi muṣkaram yathā / chinadmi asya bandhanam mūlam urvārvā iva /
column2: From the consumptive man I pluck Decline as 'twere a severed part. I cut the bond that fetters him, even as a root of cucumber.

column1: niḥ balāsā itas pra pata aśuṅgaḥ śiśukaḥ yathā / atha u itas iva hāyanaḥ apa drāhi avīra hā /
column2: Begone, Consumption, hence away, like a young foal that runs. at speed. Then, not pernicious to our men, flee, yearly visitant like grass!

column1: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ / upastiḥ astu saḥ asmākam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati //
column2: Most excellent of all the plants art thou: thy vassals are the trees. Let him be subject to our power, the man who seeks to injure us.

column1: sabandhuḥ ca asabandhuḥ ca yaḥ asmām abhidāsati / teṣām sā vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ /
column2: Whoever seeks to injure us, with kinsmen or no kin to aid, May I be uppermost of all, even as this Plant is queen of trees.

column1: yathā somaḥ oṣadhīnām uttamaḥ haviṣām kṛtaḥ / talāśāḥ vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ /
column2: As Soma hath been made the best of all oblations 'mid the plants, So, as Talāsā is the queen of trees, may I be chief of all.

column1: ābayaḥ anābayaḥ rasaḥ te ugraḥ ābayo / ā te karambham admasi / ā te karambham admasi /
column2: O Ābayu, non-Ābayu, dire is thy juice, O Ābayu; we eat the gruel made of thee.

column1: vihahlaḥ nāma te pitā madāvatī nāma te mātā / sa hina tvam asi yaḥ tvam ātmānam āvayaḥ //
column2: Vihalha is thy father's name, thy mother's is Madāvati. Yea, verily thou art not he, thou who hast well protected life.

column1: tauvilike avelaya ava ayam ailaba ailayīt / babhruḥ ca babhrukarṇaḥ ca apehi niḥ āla / alasāla asi pūrva silāñjāla asi uttarā / nīlāgalasāla //
column2: Go thou to rest, Tauvilikā! This noisy cry hath sunk to rest. Go hence, depart, Nirāla, thou! the tawny and the tawny- eared.

column1: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
column2: Even as this mighty Earth conceived the germ of all the things that be, So may the germ of life be laid in thee that thou mayst bear a son.

column1: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra imān vanaspatīn / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave / yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra parvatān girīn / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
column2: Even as this mighty Earth hath borne and bears the stately forest trees, So may the germ of life be borne in thee that thou mayst bear a son. Even as this mighty Earth hath borne and bears the mountains and the hills, So may the germ of life be borne in thee that thou mayst bear a son.

column1: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra viṣṭhitam jagat / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
column2: Even as this mighty Earth supports the moving world that dwells thereon, So may the germ of life be borne in thee that thou mayst bear a son.

column1: īrṣyāyāḥ dhrājim prathamām prathamasyāḥ uta aparām / agnim hṛdayyam śokam tam te niḥ vāpayāmasi //
column2: The first approach of Jealousy, and that which followeth the first, The pain, the fire that burns within thy heart we quench and drive away.

column1: yathā bhūmiḥ mṛta manāḥ mṛtāt mṛta manastarā / yathā uta mamruṣaḥ manaḥ eva īrṣyoḥ mṛtam manaḥ /
column2: Even as the earth is dead to sense, yea, more unconscious than the dead, Even as a corpse's spirit is the spirit of the jealous man.

column1: adaḥ yat te hṛdi śritam manaskam patayiṣṇukam / tatas te īrṣyām muñcāmi niḥ ūṣmāṇam dṛteḥ iva /
column2: The thought that harbours in thy heart, the fluttering doubt that dwells therein. Yea, all thy jealousy, like heat born of the dance, I banish thence.

column1: punantu mā deva janāḥ punantu manavaḥ dhiyā / punantu viśvā bhūtāni pavamānaḥ punātu mā /
column2: Let the Gods purify me, let men purify me with a prayer. Cleanse me all creatures that exist! may Pavamāna make me pure.

column1: pavamānaḥ punātu mā kratve dakṣāya jīvase / atha u ariṣṭatātaye /
column2: May Pavamāna make me pure for wisdom and for power and life, and unassailed security.

column1: ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca / asmān punīhi cakṣase /
column2: God Savitar, byboth of these, filter and pressing out this juice, purify us that we may see.

column1: agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ eti śuṣmiṇaḥ uta iva mattaḥ vilapan apāyati / anyam asmat icchatu kam cit avrataḥ tapuḥ vadhāya namaḥ astu takmane /
column2: He goes away as 'twere from this fierce burning fire, inebriated and lamenting he departs. Let him, the lawless, seek another and not us. Worship be paid to Fever armed with fiery heat.

column1: namaḥ rudrāya namaḥ astu takmane namaḥ rājñe varuṇāya tviṣīmate / namaḥ dive namaḥ pṛthivyai namaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ /
column2: To Rudra and to Fever be our worship paid: worship be paid to Varuna the splendid King! Worship to Dyaus, to Earth, worship be paid to Plants!

column1: paras apehi manaspāpa kim aśastāni śaṃsasi / parehi na tvā kāmaye vṛkṣām vanāni sam cara gṛheṣu goṣu me manaḥ /
column2: Sin of the Mind, avaunt! begone! Why sayest thou what none should say? Go hence away, I love thee not. Go to the forests and the trees. My heart is in our homes and cows.

column1: avaśasā niḥśasā yat parāśasā upārima jāgrataḥ yat svapantaḥ / agniḥ viśvāni apa duṣkṛtāni a juṣṭāni āre asmat dadhātu /
column2: Whatever wrong we have committed, sleeping or waking, by ill-wish, dislike, or slander, All these offences, which deserve displeasure, may Agni take from us and keep them distant.

column1: yat indra brahmaṇas pate api mṛṣā carāmasi / pracetāḥ naḥ āṅgirasaḥ duritāt pātu aṃhasaḥ /
column2: Indra and Brāhmanaspati! whatever foolish deed we plan, May provident Angirasa preserve us from the sin and woe.

column1: yaḥ na jīvaḥ asi na mṛtaḥ devānām amṛta garbhaḥ asi svapna / varuṇānī te mātā yamaḥ pitā araruḥ nāma asi /
column2: Thou, neither quick nor dead, O Sleep, art fraught with Amrit of the Gods. Thy name is Araru: thy sire is Yama; Varunāni bare thee.

column1: vidma te svapna janitram deva jāmīnām putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ / antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi //
column2: We know thy birth, O Sleep, thou art son of the sisters of the Gods; the minister of Yama thou, thou art Antaka, thou art Death. So well we know thee who thou art. Sleep, guard us from the evil dream.

column1: yathā kalām yathā śapham yatharṇam saṃnayanti / eva duṣvapnyam sarvam dviṣate sam nayāmasi //
column2: As men discharge a debt, as they pay up an eighth and half-an- eighth, So the whole evil dream do we pay and assign unto our foe.

column1: agniḥ prātaḥsavane pātu asmān vaiśvānaraḥ viśva kṛt viśva śaṃbhūḥ / sa naḥ pāvakaḥ draviṇe dadhātu āyuṣmantaḥ sahabhakṣāḥ syāma /
column2: Dear to all men, all-prosperer, all-creating, may Agni, guard us• at the morn's libation. May he, the brightly pure one, give us riches: may we have life enjoying food together.

column1: viśve devāḥ marutaḥ indraḥ asmān asmin dvitīye savane na jahyuḥ / āyuṣmantaḥ priyam eṣām vadantaḥ vayam devānām sumatau syāma /
column2: At this our second offering may Indra, Maruts, and Visve Devas never fail us. Still may the favour of the Gods be with us, blest with long life and speaking words that please them.

column1: idam tṛtīyam savanam kavīnām ṛtena ye camasam airayanta / te saudhanvanāḥ svar ānaśānāḥ su iṣṭim naḥ abhi vasyaḥ nayantu /
column2: We pour this third libation of the Sages who fashioned forth the cup in proper order. Winners of heaven, may they, Sudhanvan's children, lead our fair sacrifice to happy fortune.

column1: śyenaḥ asi gāyatra chandāḥ anu tvā rabhe / svasti mā sam vaha asya yajñasya udṛci svāhā /
column2: Thou art the Hawk, Gāyatri's lord: I hold thee fast. Happily bear me to the goal of this my sacrifice. All hail!

column1: ṛbhuḥ asi jagacchandāḥ anu tvā rabhe / svasti mā sam vaha asya yajñasya udṛci svāhā /
column2: Thou art the Ribhu, lord of Jagatī: I hold thee fast. Happily bear me to the goal of this my sacrifice. Al I hail!

column1: vṛṣā asi triṣṭubh chandāḥ anu tvā rabhe / svasti mā sam vaha asya yajñasya udṛci svāhā /
column2: Thou art the Bull, the Trishtup's lord: I hold thee fast. Happily bear me to the goal of this my sacrifice. All hail!

column1: nahi te agne tanvaḥ krūram ānaṃśa martyaḥ / kapiḥ babhasti tejanam svam jarāyu gauḥ iva /
column2: O Agni, in thy body man hath never found a wounded part. The Ape devours the arrow's shaft as a cow eats her after- birth.

column1: meṣaḥ iva vai sam ca vi ca uru acyase yat uttaradrau uparaḥ ca khādataḥ / śīrṣṇā śiraḥ apsasā apsaḥ ardayan aṃśūn babhasti haritebhiḥ āsabhiḥ / suparṇā vācam akrata upa dyavi ākhare kṛṣṇāḥ iṣirāḥ anartiṣuḥ / ni yat niyanti uparasya niṣkṛtim purū retaḥ dadhire sūrya śritaḥ /
column2: Thou like a fleece contractest and expandest thee what time the upper stone and that below devour. Closely compressing head with head and breast with breast he crunches up the tendrils with his yellow jaws. The Eagles have sent forth their voice aloud to heaven: in the sky's vault the dark impetuous ones have danced. When they come downward to repair the lower stone, they, dwellers with the Sun, have gained abundant seed.

column1: hatam tardam samaṅkam ākhum aśvinā chintam śiraḥ api pṛṣṭīḥ śṛṇītam / yavān na id adān api nahyatam mukham atha abhayam kṛṇutam dhānyāya / tarda hai pataṅga hai jabhya hā upakvasa / brahma iva a saṃsthitam haviḥ anadantaḥ imān yavān a hiṃsantaḥ apodita /
column2: Destroy the rat, the mole, the boring beetle, cut off their heads and crush their ribs, O Asvins. Bind fast their mouths; let them not eat our barley: so guard, ye twain, our growing corn from danger. Ho! boring beetle, ho! thou worm, ho! noxious grub and grasshopper! As a priest leaves the unfinished sacrifice, go hence devouring not, injuring not this corn.

column1: tardāpate vaghāpate tṛṣṭa jambhāḥ ā śṛṇota me / ye āraṇyāḥ vyadvarāḥ ye ke ca stha vyadvarāḥ tān sarvān jambhayāmasi //
column2: Hearken to me, lord of the female borer, lord of the female grub! ye rough-toothed vermin! Whate'er ye be, dwelling in woods, and piercing, we crush and mangle all those piercing insects.

column1: vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅ somaḥ ati drutaḥ / indrasya yujaḥ sakhā /
column2: Cleansed by the filter of the Wind comes Soma past all our enemies, meet friend of Indra.

column1: āpaḥ asmāt mātaraḥ sūdayantu ghṛtena naḥ ghṛtapvaḥ punantu / viśvam hi ripram pravahanti devīḥ ud id ābhyaḥ śuciḥ ā pūtaḥ emi //
column2: May the maternal Waters make us ready: cleanse us with fat- ness they who cleanse with fatness! The Goddesses bear off each blot and tarnish: I come forth from the waters cleansed and stainless.

column1: yat kim ca idam varuṇa daivye jane abhidroham manuṣyāḥ caranti / acittyā ced tava dharma yuyopima mā naḥ tasmāt enasaḥ deva rīriṣaḥ /
column2: O Varuna, whatever the offence may be, the sin which men commit against the heavenly folk— When, through our want of thought we violate thy laws, punish us not, O God, for that iniquity.

column1: ud sūryaḥ divaḥ eti puras rakṣāṃsi nijūrvan / ādityaḥ parvatebhyaḥ viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā /
column2: Slaying the Rākshasas, the Sun mounts upward in the front of heaven, Āditya, from the mountains, seen of all, destroying things unseen.

column1: ni gāvaḥ goṣṭhe asadan ni mṛgāsaḥ avikṣata / ni ūrmayaḥ nadīnam ni adṛṣṭāḥ alipsata /
column2: The kine had settled in their pen, wild animals sought their lairs The wavelets of the brooks had passed away, and were beheld no more.

column1: āyuḥ dadam vipaścitam śrutām kaṇvasya vīrudham / ābhāriṣam viśva bheṣajīm asya adṛṣṭāt ni śamayat /
column2: I have brought Kanva's famous Plant, life-giving, and itself inspired, The medicine that healeth all: may it suppress my hidden foes.

column1: dyauḥ ca me idam pṛthivī ca pracetasau śukraḥ bṛhan dakṣiṇayā pipartu / anu svadhā cikitām somaḥ agniḥ vāyuḥ naḥ pātu savitā bhagaḥ ca /
column2: May Heaven and Earth, wise pair, may lofty Sukra grant me this thing by reason of the guerdon. May Agni, Soma mark through this libation: may Vāyu, Savitar, and Bhaga guard us.

column1: punar prāṇaḥ punar ātmā naḥ aitu punar cakṣuḥ punar asuḥ naḥ aitu / vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ adabdhaḥ tanū pāḥ antar tiṣṭhāti duritāni viśvā /
column2: Again return to us our breath and spirit, again come back to us our life and vision! Vaisvānara, unscathed, our bodies' guardian, stand between us and every woe and danger!

column1: sam varcasā payasā sam tanūbhiḥ aganmahi manasā sam śivena / tvaṣṭā naḥ atra varīyaḥ kṛṇotu anu naḥ mārṣṭu tanvaḥ yat viriṣṭam /
column2: We are again united with our bodies, with happy mind, with spirit, strength, and splendour. May Tvashtar here make room for us, and freedom and smooth whate'er is injured in our bodies.

column1: idam tat yujaḥ uttaram indram śumbhāmi aṣṭaye / asya kṣatram śriyam mahīm vṛṣṭiḥ iva vardhaya tṛṇam // asmai kṣatram agnīṣomau asmai dhārayatam rayim / imam rāṣṭrasya abhīvarge kṛṇutam yujaḥ uttaram /
column2: Win the love of Indra that his friend may reach yet higher state. Increase, as rain the grass, this man's dominion and his lofty fame. Confirm the princely power in him, Agni and Soma! grant him wealth. In all the circuit of his rule make him yet higher for your friend.

column1: sabandhuḥ ca a sabandhuḥ ca yaḥ asmām abhidāsati / sarvam tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate //
column2: The man who shows us enmity, whether a stranger or akin, Thou wilt give up entire to me who sacrifice and press the juice.

column1: ye panthānaḥ bahavaḥ deva yānāḥ antarā dyāvāpṛthivī saṃcaranti / teṣām ajyānim yatamaḥ vahāti tasmai mā devāḥ pari datta iha sarve /
column2: Of all the many God-frequented pathways that traverse realms between the earth and heaven, Consign me, all ye Gods to that which leadeth to perfect and inviolable safety.

column1: grīṣmaḥ hemantaḥ śiśiraḥ vasantaḥ śarad varṣāḥ svite naḥ dadhāta / ā naḥ goṣu bhajata prajāyām nivāte id vaḥ śaraṇe syāma /
column2: Maintain us in well-being Summer, Winter Dew-time and Spring, Autumn, and Rainy Season Give us our share of cattle and of Children. May we enjoy your unassailed protection.

column1: idāvatsarāya parivatsarāya saṃvatsarāya kṛṇuta bṛhat namaḥ / teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre sau manase syāma /
column2: Pay to the Year your lofty adoration, to the first Year, the second, and the present. Many we abide in the auspicious favour and gracious love of these who claim our worship.

column1: mā naḥ devāḥ ahiḥ vadhīt satokān saha puruṣān / samyatam na vi sparat vyāttam na sam yamat namaḥ deva janebhyaḥ / namaḥ astu asitāya namaḥ tiraścirājaye / svajāya babhrave namaḥ namaḥ deva janebhyaḥ //
column2: Let not the serpent slay us, O Gods, with our children and our folk. Let it not close the opened mouth nor open that which now is closed. Be worship paid unto the black, worship to that with stripes across! To the brown viper reverence, reverence to the demon brood!

column1: sam te hanmi datā dataḥ sam u te hanvā hanū / sam te jihvayā jihvām sam u āsnāhaḥ āsyam /
column2: I close together fangs with fang, I close together jaws with jaw. I close together tongue with tongue, I close together mouth with mouth.

column1: idam id vai u bheṣajam idam rudrasya bheṣajam / yena iṣum eka tejanām śata śalyām apabravat //
column2: This is a medicine indeed, Rudra's own medicine is this, Wherewith he warns the arrow off one-shafted, with a hundred tips.

column1: jālāṣeṇa abhi siñcata jālāṣeṇa upa siñcata / jālāṣam ugram bheṣajam tena naḥ mṛḍa jīvase /
column2: Besprinkle it with anodyne, bedew it with relieving balm: Strong, soothing is the medicine: bless us therewith that we may live.

column1: śam ca naḥ mayaḥ ca naḥ mā ca naḥ kim cana amamat / kṣamā rapaḥ viśvam naḥ astu bheṣajam sarvam naḥ astu bheṣajam /
column2: Let it be health and joy to us. Let nothing vex or injure us. Down with the wound! Let all to us be balm, the whole be medicine.

column1: yaśasam mā indraḥ maghavān kṛṇotu yaśasam dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime / yaśasam mā devaḥ savitā kṛṇotu priyaḥ dātuḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ iha syām /
column2: May Indra Maghavan give me name and glory. May Heaven and Earth, this couple, make me famous. May Savitar the deity make me honoured. Here may the man who gives the guerdon love me.

column1: yathā indraḥ dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ yaśasvān yathā apaḥ oṣadhīṣu yaśasvatīḥ / eva viśveṣu deveṣu vayam sarveṣu yaśasaḥ syāma /
column2: Indra from Heaven and Earth receiveth glory among the plants the Waters have their glory; Even so may we be glorious'mid all the Universal Gods.

column1: yaśāḥ indraḥ yaśāḥ agniḥ yaśāḥ somaḥ ajāyata / yaśāḥ viśvasya bhūtasya aham asmi yaśastamaḥ /
column2: Indra and Agni were renowned, famous was Soma at his birth; So too am I illustrious, most glorious of all that is.

column1: anaḍudbhyaḥ tvam prathamam dhenubhyaḥ tvam arundhati / a dhenave vayase śarma yaccha catuṣpade /
column2: First, O Arundhatī, protect our oxen and milky kine: Protect each one that is infirm, each quadruped that yields no milk.

column1: śarma yacchatu oṣadhiḥ saha devīḥ arundhatī / karat payasvantam goṣṭham ayakṣmān uta pūruṣān / viśva rūpām subhagām achāvadāmi jīvalām / sā naḥ rudrasya āstām hetim dūram nayatu gobhyaḥ //
column2: Let the Plant give us sheltering aid, Arundhatī allied with Gods; Avert Consumption from our men and make our cow-pen rich in milk. I welcome the auspicious Plant, life-giving, wearing every hue. Far from our cattle may it turn the deadly dart which Rudra casts.

column1: ayam ā yāti aryamā purastāt viṣita stupaḥ / asyāḥ ichan agruvai patim uta jāyām a jānaye / aśramat iyam aryaman anyāsām samanam yatī / aṅga u nu aryaman asyāḥ anyāḥ samanam āyati //
column2: With forelock loosened o'er his brow here comes the wooer of the bride, Seeking a husband for this maid, a wife for this unmarried man. Wooer! this girl hath toiled in vain, going to others' marriages. Now to her wedding, verily, wooer! another maid shall come.

column1: dhātā dādhāra pṛthivīm dhātā dyām uta sūryam / dhātā asyai agruvai patim dadhātu pratikāmyam //
column2: Dhātar upholds the spacious earth, upholds the sky, upholds the Sun. Dhātar bestow upon this maid a husband suited to her wish!

column1: mahyam āpaḥ madhumat erayantām mahyam sūraḥ abharat jyotiṣe kam / mahyam devāḥ uta viśve tapaḥ jāḥ mahyam devaḥ savitā vyacaḥ dhāt / aham viveca pṛthivīm uta dyām aham ṛtūṃr ajanayam sapta sākam / aham satyam anṛtam yat vadāmi aham daivīm pari vācam viśaḥ ca /
column2: The Waters send me what is sweet and pleasant, Sūra bring all I need for light and vision! The deities, and all of pious nature, and Savitar the God afford me freedom! I set the heaven and the earth asunder, I brought all seven sea- sons into being. My word is truth, what I deny is falsehood, above celestial Vāk, above the nations.

column1: aham jajāna pṛthivīm uta dyām aham ṛtūṃr ajanayam sapta sindhūn / aham satvam anṛtam yat vadāmi yaḥ agnīṣomau ajuṣe sakhāyā /
column2: I gave existence to the earth and heaven, I made the seasons and the seven rivers. My word is truth; what I deny is falsehood, I who rejoice in Agni's, Soma's friendship.

column1: vaiśvānaraḥ raśmibhiḥ naḥ punātu vātaḥ prāṇena iṣiraḥ nabhobhiḥ / dyāvāpṛthivī payasā payasvatī ṛtāvarī yajñiye na punītām / vaiśvānarīm sūnṛtām ā rabhadhvam yasyāḥ āśāḥ tanvaḥ vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ / tayā gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādeṣu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīnām /
column2: Cleanse us Vaisvānara with rays of splendour! With breath and clouds let quickening Vāyu cleanse us. And, rich in milky rain, let Earth and Heaven, worshipful, holy, cleanse us with their water.

column1: vaiśvānarīm varcasaḥ ā rabhadhvam śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ / iha iḍayā sadhamādam madantaḥ jyok paśyema sūryam uccarantam /
column2: For splendour, seize on her whom all men worship, becoming pure yourselves, and bright, and brilliant. Here, through our prayer rejoicing in the banquet, long may we look upon the Sun ascending.

column1: yat te devī nirṛtiḥ ābabandha dāma grīvāsu avimokyam yat / tat te vi syāmi āyuṣe varcase balāya adomadam annam addhi prasūtaḥ /
column2: That collar round thy neck, not to be loosened, which Nirriti the Goddess bound and fastened, I loose for thy long life and strength and vigour. Eat, liberated, food that brings no sorrow.

column1: namaḥ astu te nirṛte tigma tejaḥ ayasmayān vi cṛtā bandha pāśān / yamaḥ mahyam punar id tvām dadāti tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave /
column2: To thee, sharp-pointed Nirriti, be homage! Loose thou the binding fetters wrought of iron. To me, in truth, again doth Yama give thee. To him, to Yama, yea, to Death, be homage!

column1: ayasmaye drupade bedhiṣe iha abhihitaḥ mṛtyubhiḥ ye sahasram / yamena tvam pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam /
column2: Compassed by death which comes in thousand manners, here art thou fastened to the iron pillar. Unanimous with Yama and the Fathers, make this man rise and reach the loftiest heaven.

column1: saṃsam id yuvase vṛṣan agne viśvāni aryaḥ ā / iḍaḥ pade sam idhyase sa naḥ vasūni ā bhara /
column2: Thou, mighty Agni, good and true, gatherest up all precious things. Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled at libation's place.

column1: sam jānīdhvam sam pṛcyadhvam sam vaḥ manāṃsi jānatām / devāḥ bhāgam yathā pūrve samjānānāḥ upāsate /
column2: Agree and be united: let your minds be all of one accord, Even as the Gods of ancient days, unanimous, await their share.

column1: samānaḥ mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānam vratam saha cittam eṣām / samānena vaḥ haviṣā juhomi samānam cetaḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam / samānī vaḥ ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ / samānam astu vaḥ manaḥ yathā vaḥ su sahā asati //
column2: The rede is common, common the assembly, common the law, so be their thoughts united. I offer up your general oblation: together entertain one common purpose. One and the same be your resolve, be all your hearts in har- mony: One and the same be all your minds that all may happily con- sent.

column1: ava manyuḥ avāyata ava bāhū manaḥ yujā / parāśara tvam teṣām parāñcam śuṣmam ardaya adha naḥ rayim ā kṛdhi //
column2: The angry spirit hath relaxed: loose are the arms that act with mind. Do thou, destroyer, overcome and drive these foemen's might away, and then bring opulence to us.

column1: nirhastebhyaḥ nairhastam yam devāḥ śarum asyatha / vṛścāmi śatrūṇām bāhūn anena haviṣā aham /
column2: The shaft for handless fiends which, Gods! ye cast against the handless ones, With this, in shape of sacrifice, I rend the arms of enemies.

column1: indraḥ cakāra prathamam nairhastam asurebhyaḥ / jayantu satvānaḥ mama sthireṇa indreṇa medinā /
column2: Indra made first for Asuras the shaft designed for handless foes: Victorious shall my heroes be with Indra as their constant friend.

column1: nirhastaḥ śatruḥ abhidāsan astu ye senābhiḥ yudham āyanti asmān / sam arpaya indra mahatā vadhena drātu eṣām agha hāraḥ vividdhaḥ /
column2: Handless be every foeman who assaileth, they who with missiles come to fight against us! Dash them together with great slaughter, Indra! and let their robber chief run pierced with arrows.

column1: ātanvānāḥ āyacchantaḥ asyantaḥ ye ca dhāvatha / nirhastāḥ śatravaḥ sthana indraḥ vaḥ adya parāśarīt /
column2: Ye who run hither bending bows, brandishing swords and cast- ing darts. Handless be ye, O enemies! Let Indra mangle you to-day.

column1: nirhastāḥ santu śatravaḥ aṅga eṣām mlāpayāmasi / atha eṣām indra vedāṃsi śataśas vi bhajāmahai /
column2: Handless be these our enemies! We enervate their languid limbs. So let us part among ourselves, in hundreds, Indra! all their wealth.

column1: pari vartmāni sarvatas indraḥ pūṣā ca sasratuḥ / muhyantu adya amūḥ senāḥ amitrāṇām parastarām /
column2: Indra and Pūshan have gone forth along the ways on every side. To-day those hosts of enemies must flee bewildered far away.

column1: mūḍhāḥ amitrāḥ carata aśīrṣāṇaḥ iva ahayaḥ / teṣām vaḥ agni mūḍhānām indraḥ hantu varaṃvaram / ā eṣu nahya vṛṣā ajinam hariṇasya bhiyam kṛdhi / parāṅ amitraḥ eṣatu arvācī gauḥ upeṣatu /
column2: Ye foes, come hitherward dismayed like serpents when their heads are gone. Let Indra slay each bravest one of you whom Agni hath con- fused. Gird thou a bullock's hide on these, make those as timid as the deer. Let the foe flee away, and let his kine come hither-ward to us.

column1: ā ayam agan savitā kṣureṇa uṣṇena vāyo udakena ihi / ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ undantu sacetasaḥ somasya rājñaḥ vapata pracetasaḥ /
column2: Savitar hath come hither with the razor: come thou, O Vāyu, with the heated water. One-minded let Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus moisten the hair: shave ye who know King Soma.

column1: aditiḥ śmaśru vapatu āpaḥ undantu varcasā / cikitsatu prajāpatiḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya cakṣase /
column2: Let Aditi shave the beard, and let the Waters bathe it with their strength: Prajāpati restore his health for sight and days of lengthened life!

column1: yena avapat savitā kṣureṇa somasya rājñaḥ varuṇasya vidvān / tena brahmāṇaḥ vapata idam asya gomān aśvavān ayam astu prajāvān //
column2: The razor used by Savitar, for shaving, who knoweth Varuna and royal Soma, Even with this shave ye this man, O Brāhman. Let him be rich in horses, kine, and children.

column1: girau aragarāṭeṣu hiranye goṣu yat yaśaḥ / surāyām sicyamānāyām kīlāle madhu tat mayi //
column2: Mine be the glory in the hill, in vales, in cattle, and in gold, Mine be the sweetness that is found in nectar and in flowing wine!
