column1: trāyadhvam naḥ agha viṣābhyaḥ vadhāt viśve devāḥ marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ / agnīṣomāḥ varuṇaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ vātāparjanyayoḥ sumatau syāma /
column2: Save us, All-Gods and all-possessing Maruts, from murderous stroke and things that slay with poison. Pure is the might of Varuna, Agni, Soma. May Vāta's and Parjanya's favour bless us.

column1: sam vaḥ manāṃsi sam vratā sam ākūtīḥ namāmasi / amī ye vivratā sthana tān vaḥ sam namayāmasi //
column2: We bend your minds in union, bend in harmony your hopes and plans: You there, who turn to sundered ways, we bend and bow in unison.

column1: aham gṛbhṇāmi manasā manāṃsi mama cittam anu cittebhiḥ eta / mama vaśeṣu hṛdayāni vaḥ kṛṇomi mama yātam anuvartmānaḥ eta /
column2: I with my spirit make your spirits captive: these with their thoughts follow my thought and wishes. I make your hearts submissive to mine order closely attending go where I precede you.

column1: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī / otau me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca rdhyāsma idam sarasvati //
column2: I have invoked both Heaven and Earth, invoked divine Sarasvati, Indra and Agni have I called: Sarasvati, so may we thrive!

column1: aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi / tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata /
column2: In the third heaven above us stands the Asvattha tree, the seat of Gods. There the Gods gained the Kushtha plant, embodiment of end- less life.

column1: hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi / tatra amṛtasya puṣpam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata /
column2: There moved through heaven a golden ship, a ship with cordage wrought of gold. There Gods obtained the Kushtha plant, the flower of immor- tality.

column1: garbhaḥ asi oṣadhīnām garbhaḥ himavatām uta / garbhaḥ viśvasya bhūtasya imam me agadam kṛdhi //
column2: Thou art the infant of the plants, the infant of the Snowy Hills: The germ of every thing that is: free this my friend from his disease.

column1: yāḥ oṣadhayaḥ soma rājñīḥ bahvīḥ śata vicakṣaṇāḥ / bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
column2: The many plants of hundred shapes and forms that Soma rules as King, Commanded by Brihaspati, deliver us from grief and woe!

column1: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta / atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt /
column2: Let them release me from the curse and from the noose of Varupa, Free me from Yama's fetter, and from every sin against the Gods!

column1: yat cakṣuṣā manasā yat ca vācā upārima jāgrataḥ yat svapantaḥ / somaḥ tāni svadhayā naḥ punātu /
column2: From every fault in look, in word, in spirit that we, awake or sleeping, have committed, May Soma, with his godlike nature, cleanse us.

column1: abhibhūḥ yajñaḥ abhibhūḥ agniḥ abhibhūḥ somaḥ abhibhūḥ indraḥ / abhi aham viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ yathā āsāni eva vidhema agnihotrāḥ idam haviḥ /
column2: The sacrifice is victor, Agni victor, victorious is Soma, Indra conquers: So will we bring oblation unto Agni, this sacrifice that I may win all battles.

column1: svadhā astu mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā prajāvat kṣatram madhunā iha pinvatam / bādhethām dūram nirṛtim parācais kṛtam cit enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat /
column2: Praise to you, Mitra-Varupa, hymn-singers! Here swell with meath dominion blest with children. Far into distant regions drive Destruction, and even from committed sin absolve us.

column1: imam vīram anu harṣadhvam ugram indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam / grāma jitam go jitam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā /
column2: In this strong hero be ye glad and joyful: cleave ye to him even as ye cleave to Indra. Victorious, kine-winner, thunder-wielder, who quells a host and with his might destroys it.

column1: indraḥ jayāti na parā jayātai adhirājaḥ rājasu rājayātai / carkṛtyaḥ īḍyaḥ vandyaḥ ca upasadyaḥ namasyū bhava iha /
column2: Indra be victor, never to be vanquished, to reign among the Kings as sovran ruler! Here be thou meet for praise and supplication, to be revered and waited on and worshipped.

column1: tvam indra adhirājaḥ śravasyuḥ tvam bhūḥ abhibhūtiḥ janānām / tvam daivīḥ viśaḥ imāḥ vi rāja āyuṣmat kṣatram ajaram te astu /
column2: Thou fain for glory, an imperial ruler, hast won dominion over men, O Indra, Of these celestial tribes be thou the sovran: long-lasting be thy sway and undecaying!

column1: prācyāḥ diśaḥ tvam indra asi rājā ūtā udīcyāḥ diśaḥ vṛtrahan śatruhaḥ asi / yatra yanti srotyāḥ tat jitam te dakṣiṇatas vṛṣabhaḥ eṣi havyaḥ /
column2: Thou governest the north and eastern regions, Indra! fiend- slayer! thou destroycst foemen. Thou hast won all, far as the rivers wander. Bull, called to help, on our right hand thou goest.

column1: abhi tvā indra varimataḥ purā tvā aṃhūraṇāt dhuve / hvayāmi ugram cettāram puruṇāmānam ekajam /
column2: Indra, before affliction comes, I call thee from the wide expanse. The mighty guardian, born alone, wearer of many names, I call.

column1: yaḥ adya senyaḥ vadhaḥ jighāṃsan naḥ udīrate / indrasya tatra bāhū samantam pari dadmaḥ /
column2: Whatever deadly missile launched to-day flies forth to slaughter us. We take both arms of Indra to encompass us on every side.

column1: pari dadmaḥ indrasya bāhū samantam trātuḥ trāyatām naḥ / deva savitar soma rājan sumanasam mā kṛṇu svastaye //
column2: We draw about us both the arms of Indra, our deliverer. May they protect us thoroughly. O Savitar, thou God, O royal Soma, make thou me pious- minded for my welfare.

column1: devāḥ aduḥ sūryaḥ dyauḥ adāt pṛthivī adāt / tisraḥ sarasvatiḥ aduḥ sa cittāḥ viṣa dūṣaṇam /
column2: The Gods and Sūrya gave the gift, the Earth and Heaven best- owed the boon. The three Sarasvatis in full accord bestowed the antidote.

column1: yat vaḥ devāḥ upajīkāḥ āsiñcan dhanvani udakam / tena deva prasūtena idam dūṣayata viṣam /
column2: That water, Upajīkās! which Gods poured for you on thirsty land, With that same water sent by Gods, drive ye away this poison here.

column1: asurāṇām duhitā asi sā devānām asi svasā / divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ saṃbhūtā sā cakartha arasam viṣam / ā vṛṣāyasva śvasihi vardhasva prathayasva ca / yathāṅgam vardhatām śepaḥ tena yoṣitam id jahi //
column2: The daughter of the Asuras art thou, and sister of the Gods. Thou who hast sprung from heaven and earth hast robbed the poison of its power. Taurum age, palpita, incresce et teipsum extende: per totum membrum increscat penis: hoc tu caede feminam.

column1: yena kṛṣam vājayanti yena hinvanti āturam / tena asya brahmaṇas pate dhanuḥ iva ā tānaya pasaḥ //
column2: Quo debilem stimulant, quo aegrum excitant (homines), hoc, O Brahmanaspatis, hujus penem in arcus modum extende.

column1: ā aham tanomi te pasaḥ adhi jyām iva dhanvani / kramasva ṛṣaḥ iva rohitam an avaglāyatā sadā /
column2: Velut nervum in arcu ego tuum fascinum extendo. Aggredere (mulierem) semper indefessus velut cervus damam.

column1: yathā ayam vāhaḥ aśvinā samaiti sam ca vartate / eva mām abhi te manaḥ samaitu sam ca vartatām //
column2: Even as this ox, O Asvins, steps and turns together with his mate, So let thy fancy turn itself, come nearer, and unite with me.

column1: ā aham khidāmi te manaḥ rāja aśvaḥ pṛṣṭyām iva / reṣma chinnam yathā tṛṇam mayi te veṣṭatām manaḥ /
column2: I, as the shaft-horse draws the mare beside him, draw thee to myself. Like grass that storm and wind have rent, so be thy mind at- tached to me!

column1: āñjanasya madughasya kuṣṭhasya naladasya ca / turaḥ bhagasya hastābhyām anurodhanam ud bhare //
column2: Swiftly from Bhaga's hands I bear away a love-compelling charm Of ointment and of sugar-cane, of Spikenard and the Kushtha plant.

column1: saṃdānam vaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ saṃdānam savitā karat / saṃdānam mitraḥ aryamā saṃdānam bhagaḥ aśvinā /
column2: Brihaspati and Savitar prepare a rope to bind you fast! Let Bhaga, Mitra, Aryaman, and both the Asvins make the bond.

column1: sam paramān sam avamān atho sam dyāmi madhyamān / indraḥ tān pari ahār dāmnā tān agne sam dyā tvam /
column2: I bind together all of them, the first, the last, the middlemost. Indra hath girded these with cord: bind them together, Agni, thou!

column1: amī ye yudham āyanti ketūn kṛtvā anīkaśas / indraḥ tān pari ahār dāmna tān agne sam dyā tvam /
column2: Those yonder who approach to fight, with banners raised along their ranks, Indra hath girded these with cord: bind them together, Agni, thou!

column1: ādānena saṃdānena amitrān ā dyāmasi / apānāḥ ye ca eṣām prāṇāḥ asunā asūn sam achidan /
column2: We bind our foemen with a bond that binds them close and holds them fast. Their breath and respiration I dissever, and their lives from life.

column1: idam ādānam akaram tapasā indreṇa saṃśitam / amitrāḥ ye atra naḥ santi tān agne ā dyā tvam /
column2: This bond, made keen by Indra, I have formed with heat of holy zeal. Securely bind our enemies, O Agni, who are standing here.

column1: ā enān dyatām indra agnī somaḥ rājā ca medinau / indraḥ marutvān ādānam amitrebhyaḥ kṛṇotu naḥ /
column2: Indra and Agni bind them fast, Soma the King, and both the Friends! May Indra, girt by Maruts, make a bond to bind our enemies.

column1: yathā manaḥ manasketaiḥ parāpatati āśumat / eva tvam kāse pra pata manasaḥ anu pravāyyam //
column2: Rapidly as the fancy flies forth with conceptions of the mind. So following the fancy's flight, O Cough, flee rapidly away.

column1: yathā bāṇaḥ su saṃśitaḥ parāpatati āśumat / eva tvam kāse pra pata pṛthivyāḥ anu saṃvatam / yathā sūryasya raśmayaḥ parāpatanti āśumat / eva tvam kāse pra pata samudrasya anu vikṣaram /
column2: Rapidly as an arrow flies away with keenly-sharpened point, So swiftly flee away, O Cough, over the region of the earth! Rapidly as the beams of light, the rays of Sūrya, fly away, So, Cough! fly rapidly away over the current of the sea!

column1: āyane te parāyane dūrvāḥ rohantu puṣpiṇīḥ / utsaḥ vā tatra jāyatām hradaḥ vā puṇḍarīkavān /
column2: Let flowery Dūrvā grass grow up about thine exit and approach. There let a spring of water rise, or lake with blooming lotuses.

column1: apām idam nyayanam samudrasya niveśanam / madhye hradasya naḥ gṛhāḥ parācīnāḥ mukhā kṛdhi //
column2: This is the place where waters meet, here is the gathering of the flood. Our home is set amid the lake: turn thou thy jaws away from it.

column1: himasya tvā jarāyuṇā śāle pari vyayāmasi / śītahradā hi naḥ bhuvaḥ agniḥ kṛṇotu bheṣajam /
column2: O House, we compass thee about with coolness to envelop thee. Cool as a lake be thou to us. Let Agni bring us healing balm!

column1: viśvajit trāyamāṇāyai mā pari dehi / trāyamāṇe dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam / trāyamāṇe viśvajite mā pari dehi / viśvajit dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam /
column2: Entrust me, Visvajit, to Trāyamānā. Guard, Trāyamānā, all our men, guard all our wealth of quadrupeds. To Visvajit entrust me, Trāyamānā. O Visvajit, guard all our men, etc.

column1: viśvajit kalyāṇyai mā pari dehi / kalyāṇi dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam / kalyāṇi sarva vide mā pari dehi / sarva vid dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam /
column2: To Visvajit entrust me, O Kalyāni. Guard, O Kalyāni, all our men, etc. To Sarvavid entrust me, O Kalyāni. O Sarvavid, guard all our men, guard all our wealth of quadrupeds.

column1: tvam naḥ medhe prathamā gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ ā gahi / tvam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ tvam naḥ asi yajñiyā /
column2: Intelligence, come first to us with store of horses and of kine! Thou with the rays of Sūrya art our worshipful and holy one.

column1: medhām aham prathamām brahmaṇvatīm brahma jūtām ṛṣiṣṭutām / prapītām brahmacāribhiḥ devānām avase huve /
column2: The first, devout Intelligence, lauded by sages, sped by prayer, Drunk by Brahmachāris, for the favour of the Gods I call.

column1: yām medhām ṛbhavaḥ viduḥ yām medhām asurāḥ viduḥ / ṛṣayaḥ bhadrām medhām yām viduḥ tām mayi ā veśayāmasi //
column2: That excellent Intelligence which Ribhus know, and Asuras, Intelligence which sages know, we cause to enter into me.

column1: yām ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ medhām medhāvinaḥ viduḥ / tayā mām adya medhayā agne medhāvinam kṛṇu //
column2: Do thou, O Agni, make me wise this day with that Intelligence. Which the creative ishis, which the men endowed with wisdom knew.

column1: medhām sāyam medhām prātar medhām madhyandinam pari / medhām sūryasya raśmibhiḥ vacasā veśayāmahe /
column2: Intelligence at eve, at morn, Intelligence at noon of day, With the Sun's beams, and by our speech we plant in us Intelligence.

column1: pippalī kṣipta bheṣajī uta atividdha bheṣajī / tām devāḥ sam akalpayan iyam jīvitavai alam /
column2: The Berry heals the missile's rent, it heals the deeply-piercing wound. The Gods prepared and fashioned it. This hath sufficient power for life.

column1: pippalyaḥ sam avadanta āyatīḥ jananāt adhi / yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ /
column2: When from their origin they came, the Berries spake among themselves: The man whom we shall find alive shall never suffer injury.

column1: asurāḥ tvā ni akhanan devāḥ tvā ud avapan punar / vātīkṛtasya bheṣajīm atho kṣiptasya bheṣajīm /
column2: Asuras buried thee in earth: the Gods again uplifted thee. Healer of sickness caused by wounds and healer of the missile's rent.

column1: pratnaḥ hi kam īḍyaḥ adhvareṣu sanāt ca hotā navyaḥ ca satsi / svām ca agne tanvam piprāyasva asmabhyam ca saubhagam ā yajasva //
column2: Yea, ancient, meet for praise at sacrifices, ever and now thou sittest down as Hotar. And now, O Agni, make thy person friendly, and win felicity for us by worship.

column1: jyeṣṭha ghnyām jātaḥ vicṛtoḥ yamasya mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam / ati enam neṣat duritāni viśvā dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya /
column2: Neath Jyaishthaghni and Yama's Two Releasers this child was born: preserve him from uprooting. He shall conduct him safe past all misfortunes to lengthened life that lasts a hundred autumns.

column1: vyāghre ahni ajaniṣṭa vīraḥ nakṣatra jāḥ jāyamānaḥ su vīraḥ / sa mā vadhīt pitaram vardhamānaḥ mā mātaram pra minīt janitrīm /
column2: Born on the Tiger's day was he, a hero, the Constellations' child, born brave and manly. Let him not wound, when grown in strength, his father, nor disregard his mother, her who bare him.

column1: imam me agne puruṣam mumugdhi ayam yaḥ baddhaḥ su yataḥ lālapīti / atas adhi te kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam yadā anunmaditaḥ asati /
column2: Unbind and loose for me this man, O Agni, who bound and well restrained is chattering folly. Afterward he will offer thee thy portion when he hath been delivered from his madness.

column1: agniḥ te ni śamayatu yadi te manaḥ udyutam / kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yathā an unmaditaḥ asasi //
column2: Let Agni gently soothe thy mind when fierce excitement troubles it. Well-skilled I make a medicine that thou no larger mayst be mad.

column1: deva enasāt unmaditam unmattam rakṣasaḥ pari / kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yadā an unmaditaḥ asati //
column2: Insane through sin against the Gods, or maddened by a demon's power— Well-skilled I make a medicine to free thee from insanity.

column1: punar tvā duḥ apsarasaḥ punar indraḥ punar bhagaḥ / punar tvā duḥ viśve devāḥ yathā anunmaditaḥ asasi /
column2: May the Apsarases release, Indra and Bhaga let thee go. May all the Gods deliver thee that thou no longer mayst be mad.

column1: mā jyeṣṭham vadhīt ayam agne eṣām mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam / sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan tubhyam devāḥ anu jānantu viśve /
column2: Let not this one, O Agni, wound the highest of these: preserve thou him from utter ruin. Knowing the way do thou untie the nooses of the she-fiend: let all the Gods approve thee.

column1: ud muñca pāśān tvam agne eṣām trayaḥ tribhiḥ utsitāḥ yebhiḥ āsan / sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan pitāputrau mātaram muñca sarvān /
column2: Rend thou the; bonds of these asunder, Agni! the, threefold noose whereby the three were fastened. Knowing the way untie the she-fiend's nooses: free all, the son, the father, and the mother.

column1: yebhiḥ pāśaiḥ parivittaḥ vibaddhaḥ aṅgeaṅge ārpitaḥ utsitaḥ ca / vi te mucyantam vimucaḥ hi santi bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva //
column2: The elder brother's bonds, still left unwedded, fettered in every limb and bound securely, Loose these, for they are bonds for loosing: Pūshan, turn woes away upon the babe-destroyer.

column1: trite devāḥ amṛjata etat enaḥ tritaḥ enat manuṣyeṣu mamṛje / tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu //
column2: This sin the Gods wiped off and laid on Trita, and Trita wiped it off on human beings. Thence if the female fiend hath made thee captive, the Gods by prayer shall banish her and free thee.

column1: marīcīḥ dhūmān pra viśa anu pāpman udārān gacchota vā nīhārān / nadīnam phenām anu tān vi naśya bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva //
column2: Enter the particles of light and vapours, go to the rising fogs or mists, O Evil! Hence! vanish in the foams of rivers. Pūshan, wipe woes away upon the babe-destroyer!

column1: dvādaśadhā nihitam tritasya apamṛṣṭam manuṣya enasāni / tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu //
column2: Stored in twelve separate places lies what Trita hath wiped away, the sins of human beings. Thence if the female fiend hath made thee captive, the Gods by prayer shall banish her and free thee.

column1: yat devāḥ deva heḍanam devāsaḥ cakṛma vayam / ādityāḥ tasmāt naḥ yuyam ṛtasya ṛtena muñcata /
column2: Whatever God-provoking wrong we priests have done, O Deities. Therefrom do ye deliver us, Ādityas! by the right of Law.

column1: ṛtasya ṛtena ādityāḥ yajatrāḥ muñcata iha naḥ / yajñam yat yajña vāhasaḥ śikṣantaḥ na upaśekima /
column2: Here set us free, O holy ones, Ādityas, by the right of Law. When striving, bringing sacrifice, we failed to offer it aright.

column1: medasvatā yajamānāḥ srucā ājyāni juhvataḥ / akāmāḥ viśve vaḥ devāḥ śikṣantaḥ na upa śekima /
column2: With ladle full of fatness we, worshippers, pouring holy oil, Striving, have failed, O all ye Gods, against our will, to offer it.

column1: yat vidvāṃsaḥ yat a vidvāṃsaḥ enāṃsi cakṛma vayam / yūyam naḥ tasmāt muñcata viśve devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ /
column2: Whatever wrong we wittingly or in our ignorance have done, Do ye deliver us therefrom, O all ye Gods, of one accord.

column1: yadi jāgrat yadi svapan enaḥ enasyaḥ akaram / bhūtam mā tasmāt bhavyam ca drupadāt iva muñcatām /
column2: If I, a sinner, when awake or sleeping have committed sin, Free me therefrom as from a stake, from present and from future guilt.

column1: drupadāt iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snātvā malāt iva / pūtam pavitreṇa iva ājyam viśve śumbhantu mā enasaḥ /
column2: As one unfastened from a stake, or cleansed by bathing after toil, As butter which the sieve hath cleansed, so all shall purge me from the sin.

column1: yat yāmam cakruḥ nikhanantaḥ agre kārṣīvaṇāḥ anna vidaḥ na vidyayā / vaivasvate rājani tat juhomi atha yajñiyam madhumat astu naḥ annam /
column2: The wealth which husbandmen aforetime, digging, like men who find their food with knowledge, buried, This to the King, Vivasvān's son, I offer, Sweet be our food and fit for sacrificing!

column1: vaivasvataḥ kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam madhu bhāgaḥ madhunā sam sṛjāti / mātuḥ yat enaḥ iṣitam naḥ āgan yat vā pitā aparāddhaḥ jihīde /
column2: May he, Vaivasvata, prepare our portion; May he whose share is mead with mead besprinkle. Our sin in hasty mood against our mother, or guilt whereby a sire is wronged and angered.

column1: yadi idam mātuḥ yadi pituḥ naḥ pari bhrātuḥ putrāt cetasaḥ enaḥ āgan / yāvantaḥ asmān pitaraḥ sacante teṣām sarveṣām śivaḥ astu manyuḥ /
column2: Whether this sin into our heart hath entered regarding mother, father, son or brother, Auspicious be to us the zeal and spirit of all the fathers who are here among us.

column1: apamityam a pratīttam yat asmi yamasya yena balinā carāmi / idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi tvam pāśān vicṛtam vettha sarvān /
column2: That which I eat, a debt which still is owing, the tribute due to Yama, which supports me, Thereby may I be free from debt, O Agni. Thou knowest how to rend all bonds asunder.

column1: iha eva santaḥ prati dadmaḥ enat jīvāḥ jīvebhyaḥ ni harāmaḥ enat / apamitya dhānyam yat jaghasā aham idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi //
column2: Still dwelling here we give again this present; we send it forth, the living from the living. Throwing away the grain whence I have eaten, thereby shall I be free from debt, O Agni.

column1: anṛṇāḥ asmin anṛṇāḥ parasmin tṛtīye loke anṛṇāḥ syāma / ye deva yānāḥ pitṛyāṇaḥ ca lokāḥ sarvān pathaḥ anṛṇāḥ ā kṣiyema /
column2: May we be free in this world and that yonder, in the third world may we be unindebted. May we, debt-free, abide in all the pathways, in all the worlds which Gods and Fathers visit.

column1: yat dhastābhyām cakṛma kilbiṣāṇi akṣāṇām gatnum upalipsamānāḥ / ugraṃpaśye ugrajitau tat adya apsarasau anu dattām ṛṇam naḥ / ugram paśye rāṣṭrabhṛt kilbiṣāṇi yat akṣa vṛttam anu dattam naḥ etat / ṛṇāt naḥ naḥ ṛṇam ertsamānaḥ yamasya loke adhirajjuḥ āyat //
column2: If we have sinned with both our hands, desiring to take the host of dice for our possession, May both Apsarases to-day forgive us that debt, the fiercely- conquering, fiercely-looking. Stern viewers of their sins who rule the people, forgive us what hash happened as we gambled. Not urging us to pay the debt we owed him, he with a cord hath gone to Yama's kingdom.

column1: yasmai ṛṇam yasya jāyām upaimi yam yācamānaḥ abhyaimi devāḥ / te vācam vādiṣuḥ mā uttarām mat deva patnī apsarasau adhītam /
column2: My creditor, the man whose wife I visit, he, Gods! whom I approach with supplication, Let not these men dominate me in speaking. Mind this, ye two Apsarases, Gods' Consorts!

column1: yat a dīvyan ṛṇam aham kṛṇomi a dāsyan agne uta saṃgṛṇāmi / vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ ud id nayāti su kṛtasya lokam /
column2: The debt which I incur, not gaming, Agni! and, not intending to repay, acknowledge, That may Vaisvānara, the best, our sovran, carry away into the world of virtue.

column1: vaiśvānarāya prati vedayāmi yadi ṛṇam saṃgaraḥ devatāsu / saḥ etān pāśān vicṛtam veda sarvān atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /
column2: I cause Vaisvānara to know, confessing the debt whose payment to the Gods is promised. He knows to tear asunder all these nooses: so may we dwell with him the gentle-minded.

column1: vaiśvānaraḥ pavitā mā punātu yat saṃgaram abhidhāvāmi āśām / an ājānan manasā yācamānaḥ yat tatra enaḥ apa tat suvāmi //
column2: Vaisvānara the Purifier purge me when I oppose their hope and break my promise, Unknowing in my heart. With supplication, whatever guilt there is in that, I banish.

column1: yat antarikṣam pṛthivīm uta dyām yat mātaram pitaram vā jihiṃsima / ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti sukṛtasya lokam /
column2: If we have injured Air, or Earth, or Heaven, if we have wronged our Mother or our Father, May Agni Gārhapatya here absolve us, and bear us up into the world of virtue.

column1: bhūmiḥ mātā aditiḥ naḥ janitram bhrātā antarikṣam abhiśastyā naḥ / dyauḥ naḥ pitā pitryāt śam bhavāti jāmim ṛtvā mā ava patsi lokāt /
column2: Earth is our Mother, Aditi our birth-place: our brother Air save us from imprecation! Dyaus, Father, save us, from the world of Fathers! My world not lost, may I approach my kindred.

column1: yatra suhārdaḥ su kṛtaḥ madanti vihāya rogam tanvaḥ svāyāḥ / aślonāḥ aṅgaiḥ a hrutāḥ svarge tatra paśyema pitarau ca putrān /
column2: There where our virtuous friends, who left behind them their bodily infirmities, are happy, Free from distortion of the limbs and lameness, may we behold, in heaven, our sons and parents.

column1: viṣāṇā pāśān vi sya adhi asmat ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye / duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema su kṛtasya lokam /
column2: Spreading them out, untie the snares that hold us, Varuna's bonds, the upper and the lower. Drive from us evil dream, drive off misfortune; then let us go in- to the world of virtue.

column1: yat dāruṇi badhyase yat ca rajjvām yat bhūmyām badhyase yat ca vācā / ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti su kṛtasya lokam /
column2: If thou art bound with cord or tied to timber, fixt in the earth, or by a word imprisoned, Our Agni Gārhapatya here shall free thee, and lead thee up into the world of virtue.

column1: ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake / preha amṛtasya yacchatām praitu baddhaka mocanam /
column2: The two auspicious stars whose name is called Releasers have gone up. Send Amrit hither, let it come freeing the captive from his bonds!

column1: vi jihīṣva lokam kṛṇu bandhāt muñcāsi baddhakam / yonyāḥ iva pracyutaḥ garbhaḥ pathaḥ sarvām anu kṣiya //
column2: Open thyself, make room: from bonds thou shalt release the prisoner. Freed, like an infant newly born, dwell in all pathways where thou wilt.

column1: etam bhāgam pari dadāmi vidvān viśvakarman prathama jāḥ ṛtasya / asmābhiḥ dattam jarasaḥ parastāt achinnam tantum anu sam tarema /
column2: This portion I who understand deliver to Visvakarman first-born son of Order. So may we follow to the end, unbroken, beyond old age, the thread which we have given.

column1: tatam tantum anu eke taranti yeṣām dattam pitryam āyanena / a bandhu eke dadataḥ prayacchantaḥ dātum ced śikṣān sa svarge eva / anvārabhethām anusaṃrabhethām etam lokam śraddadhānāḥ sacante / yat vām pakvam pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye dampatī sam śrayethām //
column2: This long-drawn thread some follow who have offered in order- ed course oblation to the Fathers: Some, offering and giving to the friendless, if they can give: herein they find their heaven. 3, Stand on my side and range yourselves in order, ye two! The faithful reach this world of Svarga. When your dressed food hath been bestowed on Agni, to guard it, wife and husband, come together!

column1: yajñam yantam manasā bṛhantam anvārohāmi tapasā sayoniḥ / upahūtāḥ agne jarasaḥ parastāt tṛtīye nāke sadhamādam madema /
column2: Dwelling with zeal I mount in spirit after the lofty sacrifice as it departeth. Agni, may we, beyond decay, invited, in the third heaven, feast and enjoy the banquet.

column1: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi / yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ aham indraḥ marutvān sa dadātu tat me /
column2: These women here, cleansed, purified, and holy, I place at rest singly, in hands of Brāhmans. May Indra, Marut-girt, grant me the blessing I long for as I pour you this libation.

column1: etam sadhasthāḥ pari vaḥ dadāmi yam śevadhim āvahāt jātavedaḥ / anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti tam sma jānīta parame vyoman /
column2: Ye who are present, unto you I offer this treasure brought to us by Jātavedas Happily will the sacrificer follow: do ye acknowledge him in highest heaven.

column1: jānīta sma enam parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthāḥ vida lokam atra / anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti iṣṭāpūrtam sma kṛṇuta āvis asmai /
column2: Do ye acknowledge him in highest heaven: ye know the world here present in assembly. In peace will he who sacrifices follow: show him the joy which comes from pious actions.

column1: devāḥ pitaraḥ pitaraḥ devāḥ / yaḥ asmi saḥ asmi //
column2: Gods are the Fathers, and the Fathers Gods. I am the very man I am.

column1: sa pacāmi sa dadāmi / sa yaje sa dattāt mā yūṣam /
column2: I cook, I give, I offer up oblation. From what I gave let me not be disparted.

column1: nāke rājan prati tiṣṭha tatra etat prati tiṣṭhatu / viddhi pūrtasya naḥ rājan sa deva sumanāḥ bhava //
column2: O King, take thou thy stand in heaven, there also let that gift be placed. Recognize, King, the gift which we have given, and be gracious, God!

column1: divaḥ nu mām bṛhataḥ antarikṣāt apām stokaḥ abhī apaptat rasena / sam indriyena payasā aham agne chandobhiḥ yajñaiḥ su kṛtām kṛtena /
column2: From the high firmament, yea, out of heaven a water-drop with dew on me hath fallen. I, Agni! share the merit of the pious, with vigour, milk, and hymns and sacrifices.

column1: yadi vṛkṣāt abhyapaptat phalam tat yadi antarikṣāt saḥ u vāyuḥ eva / yatra aspṛkṣat tanvaḥ yat ca vāsasaḥ āpaḥ nudantu nirṛtim parācais /
column2: If from a tree that fruit hath fallen downward if, aught from air that is vāyu. Where it hath touched my body or my garment, thence may the Waters drive Destruction backward.

column1: abhyañjanam surabhi sā samṛddhiḥ hiraṇyam varcaḥ tat u pūtrimam eva / sarvā pavitrā vitatā adhi asmat tat mā tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ /
column2: It is a fragrant ointment, happy fortune, sheen all of gold, yea, purified from blemish. Spread over us are all purifications. Death and Malignity shall not subdue us.

column1: vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ asmad sakhā prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ / gobhiḥ saṃnaddhaḥ asi vīḍayasva āsthātā te jayatu jetvāni //
column2: Mayst thou, O Tree, be firm indeed in body, our friend that furthers us, a goodly hero. Put forth thy strength, compact with thongs of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.

column1: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari ojaḥ udbhṛtam vanaspatibhyaḥ pari ābhṛtam sahaḥ / apām ojmānam pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam indrasya vajram haviṣā ratham yaja //
column2: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood. Honour with sacrifice the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car girt round with straps, the vigour of the floods.

column1: indrasya ojaḥ marutām anīkam mitrasya garbhaḥ varuṇasya nābhiḥ / saḥ imām naḥ havya dātim juṣāṇaḥ deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya //
column2: Thou bolt of Indra, vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuna and child of Mitra, As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O godlike Chariot, these oblations.

column1: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyam purutrā te vanvatām viṣṭhitam jagat / sa dundubhe sajūs indreṇa devaiḥ dūrāt davīyaḥ apa sedha śatrūn /
column2: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee. O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.

column1: ā krandaya balam ojaḥ naḥ ā dhāḥ abhi stana duritā bādhamānaḥ / apa sedha dundubhe duchunām itas indrasya muṣṭiḥ asi vīḍayasva /
column2: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour, yea, thunder forth and drive away misfortunes. Drive hence, O Drum, drive thou away mischances. Thou art the fist of Indra, show thy firmness.

column1: pra amūm jaya abhīme jayantu ketumat dundubhiḥ vāvadītu / sam aśva parṇāḥ patantu naḥ naraḥ asmākam indra rathinaḥ jayantu /
column2: Conquer those yonder and let these be victors. Let the Drum speak aloud as battle's signal. Let our men, winged with horses, fly together. Let our car- warriors, Indra! be triumphant.

column1: vidradhasya balāsasya lohitasya vanaspate / visalpakasya auṣadhe mā ud śiṣaḥ piśitam cana /
column2: Of abscess, of decline, of inflammation of the eyes. O Plant, Of penetrating pain, thou Herb, let not a particle remain.

column1: yau te balāsa tiṣṭhataḥ kakṣe muṣkau apaśritau / veda aham tasya bheṣajam cīpudruḥ abhicakṣaṇam /
column2: Those nerves of thine, Consumption! which stand closely hidden in thy groin I know the balm for that disease: the magic cure is Sipudru.

column1: yaḥ aṅgyaḥ yaḥ karṇyaḥ yaḥ akṣyoḥ visalpakaḥ / vi vṛhāmaḥ visalpakam vidradham hṛdaya āmayam / parā tam a jñātam yakṣmam adharāñcam suvāmasi //
column2: We draw from thee piercing pain that penetrates and racks thy limbs, That pierces ears, that pierces eyes, the abscess, and the heart's disease. Downward and far away from thee we banish that unknown. decline.

column1: śakadhūmam nakṣatrāṇi yat rājānam akurvata / bhadra aham asmai prāyacchan idam rāṣṭram asāt iti /
column2: What time the heavenly bodies chose the Weather Prophet as their King, They brought him favouring weather, and, Let this be his do- main, they said.

column1: bhadra aham naḥ madhyaṃdine bhadra aham sāyam astu naḥ / bhadra aham naḥ ahnām prātā rātrī bhadra aham astu naḥ /
column2: May we have weather fair at noon, May we have weather fair at eve, Fair weather when the morning breaks, fair weather when the night is come.

column1: ahar rātrābhyām nakṣatrebhyaḥ suryācandramasābhyām / bhadra aham asmabhyam rājan śakadhūma tvam kṛdhi // yaḥ naḥ bhadra aham akaraḥ sāyam naktam atho divā / tasmai te nakṣatra rāja śakadhūma sadā namaḥ /
column2: Fair weather to the day and night, and to the stars and sun and moon. Give favourable weather thou, King, Weather Prophet, unto us. Be worship ever paid to thee, O Weather Prophet, King of Star s, Who gavest us oo weather in the evening and by night and day!

column1: bhagena mā śāṃśapena sākam indreṇa medinā / kṛṇomi bhaginam mā apa drāntu arātayaḥ /
column2: With fortune of the Sisu tree—with Indra as my friend to aid I give myself a happy fate. Fly and begone, Malignities!

column1: yena vṛkṣām abhyabhavaḥ bhagena varcasā saha / tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ /
column2: That splendour and felicity wherewith thou hast excelled the trees Give me therewith a happy fate. Fly and begone, Malignities

column1: yaḥ andhaḥ yaḥ punaḥsaraḥ bhagaḥ vṛkṣeṣu āhitaḥ / tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ / ratha jitām rātha jiteyīnām apsarasām ayam smaraḥ / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu // asau me smaratāt iti priyaḥ me smaratāt iti / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
column2: This is the Apsarases' love-spell, the conquering, resistless ones'. Send the spell forth, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me. I pray, may he remember me, think of me, loving and beloved. Send forth the spell, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.

column1: yathā mama smarāt asau na amuṣya aham kadā cana / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
column2: That he may think of me, that I may never, never think of him,. Send forth the spell, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.

column1: ud mādayata marutaḥ ud antarikṣa mādaya / agne ud mādaya tvam asau mām anu śocatu /
column2: Madden him, Maruts, madden him. Madden him, madden him, O Air. Madden him, Agni, madden him. Let him consume with love of me.

column1: ni śīrṣataḥ ni pattataḥ ādhyaḥ ni tirāmi te / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
column2: Down upon thee, from head to foot, I draw the pangs of long- ing love. Send forth the charm, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.

column1: anumate anu idam manyasva akute sam idam namaḥ / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
column2: Assent to this, O Heavenly Grace! Celestial Purpose, guide it well! Send forth the charm, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.

column1: yat dhāvasi tri yojanam pañca yojanam āśvinam / tatas tvam punar āyasi putrāṇām naḥ asaḥ pitā /
column2: If thou shouldst run three leagues away, five leagues, a horse's daily stage, Thence thou shalt come to me again and be the father of our sons.

column1: yam devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā / yam viśve devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /
column2: The Philter, burning with the pangs of yearning love, which Gods have poured within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree. The charm which, burning with the pangs of love, the General Gods have poured within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.

column1: yam indrāṇī smaram asiñcat apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā / yam indra agnī smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā / yam mitrāvaruṇau smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /
column2: The charm, aglow with longing, which Indra and Agni have effused within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree. The charm aglow with longing which Mitra and Varuna have poured within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.

column1: yaḥ imām devaḥ mekhalām ābabandha yaḥ saṃnanāha yaḥ u naḥ yuyoja / yasya devasya praśiṣā carāmaḥ sa pāram ichāt saḥ u naḥ vi muñcāt /
column2: By the direction of that God we journey, he will seek means to save and he will free us; The God who hath engirt us with this Girdle, he who hath fast- ened it, and made us ready.

column1: āhutā asi abhihuta ṛṣīṇām asi āyudham / pūrvā vratasya prāśnatī vīra ghnī bhava mekhale /
column2: Thou, weapon of the Rishis, art adored and served with sacrifice. First tasting of the votive milk, Zone, be a hero-slayer thou!

column1: mṛtyoḥ aham brahmacārī yat asmi niryācan bhūtāt puruṣam yamāya / tam aham brahmaṇā tapasā śrameṇa anayā enam mekhalayā sināmi //
column2: As I am now Death's Brahmachāri claiming out of the living world a man for Yama, So with Austerity and Prayer and Fervour I bind this Girdle round the man before me.

column1: śraddhāyāḥ duhitā tapasaḥ adhi jātā svasā ṛṣīṇām bhūta kṛtām babhūva / sā naḥ mekhale matim ā dhehi medhām atha u naḥ dhehi tapaḥ indriyam ca /
column2: She hath become, Faith's daughter, sprung from Fervour, the sister of the world-creating Rishis; As such, O Girdle, give us thought and wisdom, give us religious zeal and mental vigour.

column1: yām tvā pūrve bhūta kṛtaḥ ṛṣayaḥ paribedhire / sā tvam pari svajasva mām dīrgha āyu tvāya mekhale /
column2: Thou whom primeval Rishis girt about them, they who made the world, As such do thou encircle me, O Girdle, for long days of life.

column1: ayam vajraḥ tarpayatām ṛtasya ava asya rāṣṭram apa hantu jīvitam / śṛṇātu grīvāḥ pra śṛṇātu uṣṇihāḥ vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ /
column2: This Thunderbolt shall take its fill of Order, scare life away and overthrow the kingdom. Tear necks in pieces. rend napes asunder, even as the Lord of Might the neck of Vritra.

column1: adharaḥ adharaḥ uttarebhyaḥ gūḍhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ mā ud sṛpat / vajreṇa avahataḥ śayām / yaḥ jināti tam anviccha yaḥ jināti tam id jahi / jinataḥ vajra tvam sīmantam anvañcam anu pātaya //
column2: Down, down beneath the conquerors, let him not rise, concealed in earth, but lie down-smitten with the bolt. Seek out the fierce oppressor, yea, strike only the oppressor dead. Down on the fierce oppressor's head strike at full length, O Thunderbolt!

column1: yat aśnāmi balam kurve ittham vajram ā dade / skandhān amuṣya śātayan vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ /
column2: Whate'er I eat I turn to strength, and thus I grasp the Thunder- bolt, Rending the shoulders of that man as Indra shattered Vritra's neck.

column1: yat pibāmi sam pibāmi samudraḥ iva saṃpibaḥ / prāṇān amuṣya saṃpāya sam pibāmaḥ amum vayam / yat girāmi sam girāmi samudraḥ iva saṃgiraḥ / prāṇān amuṣya saṃgīrya sam girāmaḥ amum vayam /
column2: I drink together what I drink, even as the sea that swallows all. Drinking the life-breath of that man, we drink that man and swallow him. Whate'er I eat I swallow up, even as the sea that swallows all. Swallowing that man's vital breath, we swallow him completely up.

column1: devī devyām adhi jātā pṛthivyām asi oṣadhe / tām tvā nitatni keśebhyaḥ dṛṃhaṇāya khanāmasi //
column2: Born from the bosom of wide Earth the Goddess, godlike Plant, art thou: So we, Nitatnī! dig thee up to strengthen and fix fast the hair.

column1: dṛṃha pratnān janaya a jātān jātān u varṣīyasaḥ kṛdhi //
column2: Make the old firm, make new hair spring, lengthen what has already grown.

column1: yaḥ te keśaḥ avapadyate sa mūlaḥ yaḥ ca vṛścate / idam tam viśva bheṣajyā abhi siñcāmi vīrudhā / yām jamadagniḥ akhanat duhitre keśa vardhanīm / tām vītahavyaḥ ābharat asitasya gṛhebhyaḥ //
column2: Thy hair where it is falling off, and with the roots is torn away, I wet and sprinkle with the Plant, the remedy for all disease. The Plant which Jamadagni dug to make his daughter's locks. grow long, This same hath Vitahavya brought to us from Asita's abode.

column1: abhīśunā meyāḥ āsan vyāmena anumeyāḥ / keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari / dṛṃha mūlam āgram yaccha vi madhyam yāmaya oṣadhe / keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari /
column2: They might be measured with a rein, meted with both extended arms. Let the black locks spring thick and strong and grow like reeds upon thy head. Strengthen the roots, prolong the points, lengthen the middle part, O Plant. Let the black locks spring thick and strong and grow like reeds upon thy head.

column1: tvam vīrudhām śreṣṭhatamā abhiśrutā asi oṣadhe / imam me adya puruṣam klībam opaśinam kṛdhi //
column2: O Plant, thy fame is spread abroad as best of all the herbs that grow. Unman for me to-day this man that he may wear the horn of hair.

column1: klībam kṛdhi opaśinam atha u kurīriṇam kṛdhi / atha asya indraḥ grāvabhyām ubhe bhinattu āṇḍyau /
column2: Make him a eunuch with a horn, set thou the crest upon his- head. Let Indra with two pressing-stones deprive him of his manly strength.

column1: klība klībam tvā akaram vadhre vadhrim tvā akaram arasa arasam tvā akaram / kurīram asya śīrṣaṇi kumbam ca adhinidadhmasi // ye te nādyau deva kṛte yayoḥ tiṣṭhati vṛṣṇyam / te te bhinadmi śamyayā amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ /
column2: I have unmanned thee, eunuch! yea, impotent! made thee- impotent, and robbed thee, weakling! of thy strength. Upon his head we set the horn, we set the branching ornament. Duas tuas venas, a Diis factas, in quibus stat vigor virilis, paxillo ligneo in testiculis ob istam mulierem tibi findo.

column1: yathā naḍam kaśipune striyaḥ bhindanti aśmanā / eva bhinadmi te śepaḥ amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ /
column2: Ut mulieres mattam (tegetem) facturae arundinem lapide findunt, sic fascinum tuum cum testiculis ob istam mulierem findo.

column1: nyastikā rurohitha subhagaṃkaraṇī mama / śatam tava pratānāḥ trayastriṃśat nitānāḥ / tayā sahasraparṇyā hṛdayam śoṣayāmi te //
column2: Thou hast grown up, a source of joy to bless me with pros- perity. A hundred are thy tendrils, three-and-thirty thy descending shoots. With this that bears a thousand leaves I dry thy heart and wither it.

column1: śuṣyatu mayi te hṛdayam atho śuṣyatu āsyam / atho ni śuṣya mām kāmena atho śuṣka āsyā cara /
column2: Let thy heart wither for my love and let thy month be dry for me. Parch and dry up with longing, go with lips that love of me hath dried.

column1: saṃvananī samuṣpalā babhru kalyāṇi sam nuda / amūm ca mām ca sam nuda samānam hṛdayam kṛdhi //
column2: Drive us together, tawny! fair! a go-between who wakens love. Drive us together, him and me, and give us both one heart and mind.

column1: yathā udakam apapuṣaḥ apaśuṣyati āsyam / eva ni śuṣya mām kāmena atho śuṣka āsyā cara /
column2: Even as his mouth is parched who finds no water for his burn- ing thirst, So parch and burn with longing, go with lips that love of me hath dried.

column1: yathā nakulaḥ vichidya saṃdadhāti ahim punar / eva kāmasya vichinnam sam dhehi vīryāvati //
column2: Even as the Mungoose bites and rends and then restores the wounded snake, So do thou, Mighty one, restore the fracture of our severed love.

column1: yau vyāghrau avarūdhau jighatsataḥ pitaram mātaram ca / tau dantam brahmaṇas pate śivau kṛṇu jātavedaḥ /
column2: Two tigers have grown up who long to eat the mother and the sire: Soothe, Brāhmanaspati, and thou, O Jātavedas, both these teeth.

column1: vrīhim attam yavam attam atho māṣam atho tilam / eṣa vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ ratna dheyāya dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca / upahūtau sayujau syonau dantau su maṅgalau / anyatra vām ghoram tanvaḥ paraitu dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca /
column2: Let rice and barley be your food, eat also beans and sesamum. This is the share allotted you, to be your portion, ye two Teeth. Harm not your mother and your sire. Both fellow teeth have been invoked, gentle and bringing happi- ness. Else whither let the fierceness of your nature turn away, O Teeth! Harm not your mother or your sire.

column1: vāyuḥ enāḥ samākarat tvaṣṭā poṣāya dhriyatām / indraḥ ābhyaḥ adhi bravat rudraḥ bhūmne cikitsatu /
column2: Vayu collected these: to find their sustenance be Tvashtar's care: May Indra bless and comfort them, and Rudra look that they increase.

column1: yathā cakruḥ deva asurāḥ yathā manuṣyāḥ uta / eva sahasra poṣāya kṛṇutam lakṣmā aśvinā / ud śrayasva bahuḥ bhava svena mahasā yava / mṛṇīhi viśvā pātrāṇi mā tvā divyā aśaniḥ vadhīt / āśṛṇvantam yavam devam yatra tvā āchāvadāmasi / tat ud śrayasva dyauḥ iva samudraḥ iva edhi akṣitaḥ /
column2: Take thou the iron axe and make a pair by marks upon their ears. This sign the Asvins have impressed: let these increase and multiply. Even as Gods and Asuras, even as mortal men have done, Do ye, that these may multiply in thousands, Asvins! make the mark.

column1: akṣitāḥ te upasadaḥ akṣitāḥ santu rāśayaḥ / pṛṇantaḥ akṣitāḥ santu attāraḥ santu akṣitāḥ / dhītī vā ye anayan vācaḥ agram manasā vā ye avadan ṛtāni / tṛtīyena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānāḥ turīyeṇa amanvata nāma dhenoḥ /
column2: They who by thought have guided all that Speech hath best, or they who with their heart have uttered words of truth, Made stronger by the strength which the third prayer bestows, have by the fourth prayer learned the nature of the Cow.

column1: sa veda putraḥ pitaram sa mātaram sa sūnuḥ bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ / sa dyām aurṇot antarikṣam svar saḥ idam viśvam abhavat saḥ ābharat // atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum mātuḥ garbham pituḥ asum yuvānam / yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ // ayā viṣṭhā janayan karvarāṇi sa hi ghṛṇiḥ uruḥ varāya gātuḥ / sa pratyudait dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram svayā tanvā tanvam airayata //
column2: Well knows this son his sire, he knows his mother well: he hath been son, and he hath been illiberal. He hath encompassed heaven, and air's mid-realm, and sky; he hath become this All; he hath come nigh to us. Invoke for us, proclaim in sundry places, the kinsman of the Gods, our sire Atharvan, His mother's germ, his father's breath, the youthful, who with his mind hath noticed this oblation.

column1: ekayā ca daśabhiḥ ca su hute dvābhyām iṣṭaye viṃśatyā ca / tisṛbhiḥ ca vahase triṃśatā ca viyugbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vi muñca //
column2: With thine eleven teams, to aid our wishes, yea, with thy two- and-twenty teams, O Vāyu, With all thy three-and-thirty teams for drawing, here loose these teams, thou who art prompt to listen!

column1: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan / te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ /
column2: The Gods adored the Sacrifice with worship: these were the statutes of primeval ages. Those mighty ones attained the cope of heaven, there where the Sādhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

column1: yajñaḥ babhūva saḥ ā babhūva sa pra jajñe saḥ u vāvṛdhe punar / sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva saḥ asmāsu draviṇam ā dadhātu //
column2: Sacrifice was, was manifest among us: it sprang to life and then in time grew stronger. Then it became thedeities' lord and ruler: may it bestow on us abundant riches.

column1: yat devāḥ devān haviṣā ayajanta amartyān manasā martyena / madema tatra parame vyoman paśyema tat uditau sūryasya //
column2: Where the Gods worshipped Gods with their oblation, worship- ped immortals with immortal spirit, There in the loftiest heaven may we be happy, and look upon that light when Sūrya rises.

column1: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā yajñam devāḥ atanvata / asti nu tasmāt ojīyaḥ yat vihavyena ijire /
column2: With their oblation, Purusha, the Gods performed a sacrifice. A sacrifice more potent still they paid with the invoking hymn.

column1: mugdhāḥ devāḥ uta śunā ayajanta uta goḥ aṅgaiḥ purudhā ayajanta / yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ //
column2: With dog the Gods, perplexed, have paid oblation, and with cow's limbs in sundry sacrifices. Invoke for us, in many a place declare him who with his mind. hath noticed this our worship.

column1: mahīm u su mātaram suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase havāmahe / tuvi kṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīm su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim // su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim / daivīm nāvam svaritrām anāgasaḥ asravantīm ā ruhema svastaye /
column2: I have sung praise to Diti's sons and Aditi's, those very lofty and invulnerable Gods. For far within the depths of ocean is their home and in the wor- ship paid them none excelleth these.

column1: diteḥ putrāṇām aditeḥ akāriṣam ava devānām bṛhatām anarmaṇām / teṣām hi dhāma gabhiṣak samudriyam na enān namasā paraḥ asti kaścana /
column2: I have sung praise to Diti's sons and Aditi's, those very lofty and invulnerable Gods. For far within the depths of ocean is their home and in the wor- ship paid them none excelleth these.

column1: bhadrāt adhi śreyaḥ prehi bṛhaspatiḥ puraetā te astu / atha imam asyāḥ vare ā pṛthivyāḥ āreśatrum kṛṇuhi sarva vīram /
column2: Go forward on thy way from good to better: Brihaspati pre- cede thy steps and guide thee! Place this man here, within this earth's enclosure, afar from foes with all his men about him.

column1: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ / ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan //
column2: Pūshan was born to move on distant pathways, on roads remote from earth, remote from heaven. To both most lovely places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.

column1: pūṣā imāḥ āśāḥ anu veda sarvāḥ saḥ asmām abhayatamena neṣat / svasti dāḥ āghṛṇiḥ sarva vīraḥ a prayucchan puras etu prajānan //
column2: Pūshan knows all these realms: may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger. Giver of blessings, glowing, all heroic, may he the wise and watchful go before us.

column1: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana / stotāraḥ te iha smasi //
column2: We are thy praisers here, O Pūshan: never let us be injured under thy protection.

column1: pari pūṣā parastāt hastam dadhātu dakṣiṇam / punar naḥ naṣṭam ājatu sam naṣṭena gamemahi //
column2: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pūshan stretch his right hand forth. Let him drive back our lost to us, let us return with what is lost.

column1: yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayuḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yaḥ sumnayuḥ su havaḥ yaḥ su datraḥ / yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ /
column2: That breast of thine, exhaustless and delightful, good to invoke, beneficent, free giver. Wherewith thou feedest all things that are choicest, bring that, Sarasvati, that we may drain it.

column1: yaḥ te pṛthu stanayitnuḥ yaḥ ṛṣvaḥ daivaḥ ketuḥ viśvam ābhūṣati idam / mā naḥ vadhīḥ vidyutā deva sasyam mā uta vadhiḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya /
column2: That far-spread thunder, sent from thee, which cometh on all this world, a high celestial signal Strike not, O God, our growing corn with lightning, not kill it with the burning rays of Sūrya.

column1: sabhā ca mā samitiḥ ca avatām prajāpateḥ duhitarau saṃvidāne / yena saṃgacchāḥ upa mā sa śikṣāt cāru vadāni pitaraḥ saṃgateṣu /
column2: In concord may Prajapati's two daughters, Gathering and As- sembly, both protect me. May every man I meet respect and aid me. Fair be my words, O Fathers, at the meetings.

column1: vidma te sabhe nāma nariṣṭā nāma vai asi / ye te ke ca sabhāsadaḥ te me santu savācasaḥ /
column2: We know thy name, O Conference: thy name is interchange of talk. Let all the company who join the Conference agree with me.

column1: eṣām aham samāsīnānām varcaḥ vijñānam ā dade / asyāḥ sarvasyāḥ saṃsadaḥ mām indra bhaginam kṛṇu //
column2: Of these men seated here I make the splendour and the lore mine own. Indra, make me conspicuous in all this gathered company.

column1: yat vaḥ manaḥ parāgatam yat baddham iha vā iha vā / tat vaḥ ā vartayāmasi mayi vaḥ ramatām manaḥ /
column2: Whether your thoughts are turned away, or bound and fastened here or there, We draw them hitherward again: let your mind firmly rest on me.

column1: yathā sūryaḥ nakṣatrāṇām udyan tejāṃsi ādade / eva strīṇām ca puṃsām ca dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade / yāvantaḥ mā sapatnānām āyantam pratipaśyatha / udyan sūryaḥ iva suptānām dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade /
column2: As the Sun, rising, taketh to himself the brightness of the stars,. So I assume the glory of women and men mine enemies. All ye amang my rivals who behold me as I come to you, I seize the glory of my foes as the Sun, rising, theirs who sleep.

column1: abhi tyam devam savitāram oṇyoḥ kavi kratum / arcāmi satya savam ratna dhām abhi priyam matim //
column2: I praise this God, parent of heaven and earth, exceeding wiser possessed of real energy, giver of treasure, thinker dear to all,.

column1: urdhvā yasya amatiḥ bhās adidyutat savīmani / hiraṇya pāṇiḥ amimīta sukratuḥ kṛpāt svar /
column2: Whose splendour is sublime, whose light shone brilliant in crea- tion, who, wise, and golden-handed, in his beauty made the sky.

column1: sāvīḥ hi deva prathamāya pitre varṣmāṇam asmai varimāṇam asmai / atha asmabhyam savitar vāryāṇi divodivaḥ ā suva bhūri paśvaḥ /
column2: As thou, God! quickening, for our ancient father, sentest him height above and room about him, So unto us, O Savitar, send treasures, abundant, day by day, in shape of cattle.

column1: damūnāḥ devaḥ savitā vareṇyaḥ dadhat ratnam pitṛbhyaḥ āyūṃṣi / pibāt somam mamadat enam iṣṭe parijmā cit kramate asya dharmaṇi //
column2: Savitar, God, our household friend, most precious, hath sent our fathers life and power and riches. Let him drink Soma and rejoice when worshipped. Under his law even the Wanderer travels.

column1: tām savitar satya savām su citrām āham vṛṇe sumatim viśva vārām / yām asya kaṇvaḥ aduhat prapīnām sahasra dhārām mahiṣaḥ bhagāya //
column2: I choose, O Savitar, that glorious favour, with fruitful energy and every blessing, Even this one's teeming cow, erst milked by Kanva, thousand- streamed, milked for happiness by the mighty.

column1: bṛhaspate savitar vardhaya enam jyotaya enam mahate saubhagāya / saṃśitam cit saṃtaram sam śiśādhi viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ /
column2: Increase this man Brihaspati! Illume him, O Savitar, for high and happy fortune. Sharpen him thoroughly though already sharpened: with glad acclaim let all the Gods receive him.

column1: dhātā dadhātu naḥ rayim īśānaḥ jagataḥ patiḥ / sa naḥ pūrṇena yacchatu //
column2: May the Ordainer give us wealth, Lord, ruler of the world of life: with full hand may he give to us.

column1: dhātā dadhātu dāśuṣe prācīm jīvātum akṣitām / vayam devasya dhīmahi sumatim viśva rādhasaḥ / dhātā viśvā vāryā dadhātu prajā kāmāya dāśuṣe duroṇe / tasmai devāḥ amṛtam sam vyayantu viśve devāḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
column2: May Dhātar grant the worshipper henceforth imperishable life. May we obtain the favour of the God who giveth every boon. To him may Dhātar grant all kinds of blessings who, craving children, serves him in his dwelling. Him may the Gods invest with life eternal, yea, all the Gods and Aditi accordant.

column1: dhātā rātiḥ savitā idam juṣantām prajāpatiḥ nidhi patiḥ naḥ agniḥ / tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ yajamānāya draviṇam dadhātu /
column2: May this our gift please Savitar, Rāti, Dhātar, Prajāpati, and Agni Lord of Treasures. May Tvashtar, Vishnu, blessing him with children, give store ot riches to the sacrificer.

column1: pra nabhasva pṛthivi bhinddhi idam divyam nabhaḥ / udnaḥ divyasya naḥ dhātar īśānaḥ vi syāḥ dṛtim //
column2: Burst open, Prithvi, and cleave asunder this celestial cloud. Untie, O Dhātar—for thou canst—the bottle of the breast of heaven.

column1: na ghraṃs tatāpa na himaḥ jaghāna pra nabhatām pṛthivī jīra dānuḥ / āpaḥ cit asmai ghṛtam id kṣaranti yatra somaḥ sadam id tatra bhadram //
column2: Let not the Sun's heat burn, nor cold destroy her. Let Earth with all her quickening drops burst open. Even for her the waters flow, and fatness: where Soma is even there is bliss for ever.

column1: prajāpatiḥ janayati prajāḥ imāḥ dhātā dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ / saṃjānānāḥ saṃmanasaḥ sayonayaḥ mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu //
column2: Prajapati engenders earthly creatures: may the benevolent Ordainer form them, Having one common womb, and mind, and spirit. He who is. Lord of Plenty give me plenty!

column1: anu adya naḥ anumatiḥ yajñam deveṣu manyatām / agniḥ ca havyavāhanaḥ bhavatām dāśuṣe mama /
column2: Anumati approve to-day our sacrifice among the Gods! May Agni bear mine offerings away for me the worshipper.

column1: anu id anumate tvam maṃsase śam ca naḥ kṛdhi / juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ /
column2: Do thou, Anumati! approve, and grant us health and happiness. Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, give us progeny.

column1: anu manyatām anumanyamānaḥ prajāvantam rayim a kṣīyamāṇam / tasya vayam heḍasi mā api bhūma su mṛḍīke asya sumatau syāma /
column2: May he approving in return accord us wealth inexhaustible with store of children. Never may we be subject to his anger, but rest in his benevo- lence and mercy.

column1: yat te nāma su havam su praṇīte anumate anumatam sudānu / tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram / ā imam yajñam anumatiḥ jagāma su kṣetra tāyai su vīra tāyai su jātam / bhadrā hi asyāḥ pramatiḥ babhūva sā imam yajñam avatu deva gopā /
column2: Thy name is easy to invoke, good leader! approved, Anumati and rich in bounty. Source of all bonds! fill up therewith our worship, and, Blest One! grant us wealth with goodly heroes. Anumati hath come to this our worship well-formed to give good lands and valiant heroes: For her kind care hath blessed us. God-protected, may she assist the sacrifice we offer.

column1: anumatiḥ sarvam idam babhūva yat tiṣṭhati carati yat u ca viśvam ejati / tasyāḥ te devi sumatau syāma anumate anu hi maṃsase naḥ /
column2: Anumati became this All, whatever standeth or walketh, every- thing that moveth. May we enjoy thy gracious love, O Goddess. Regard us, O Anu- mati, with favour.

column1: sameta viśve vacasā patim divaḥ ekaḥ vibhūḥ atithiḥ janānām / sa pūrvyaḥ nūtanam āvivāsat tam vartaniḥ anu vāvṛte ekam id puru /
column2: With prayer come all together to the Lord of Heaven: he is the peerless one, far-reaching, guest of men. He, God of ancient time, hath gained a recent thrall; to him alone is turned the path which all must tread.

column1: ayam sahasram ā naḥ dṛśe kavīnām matiḥ jyotiḥ vidharmaṇi //
column2: Unto a thousand sages he hath given sight: thought, light is he in ranging all.

column1: bradhnaḥ samīcīḥ uṣasaḥ sam airayan / arepasaḥ sacetasaḥ svasare manyumattamāḥ cite goḥ //
column2: The Bright One hath sent forth the Dawns, a closely gathered band, Immaculate, unanimous, brightly refulgent in their homes.

column1: dauṣvapnyam daurjīvityam rakṣaḥ abhvam arāyyaḥ / durṇāmnīḥ sarvāḥ durvācaḥ tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi //
column2: The fearful dream, and indigence, the monster, the malignant hags. All female fiends of evil name and wicked tongue we drive afar.

column1: yat naḥ indraḥ akhanat yat agniḥ viśve devāḥ marutaḥ yat su arkāḥ / tat asmabhyam savitā satya dharmā prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ ni yacchāt /
column2: What treasure hath been dug for us by Indra, by Agni, Visve- devas, tuneful Maruts, On us may Savitar whose laws are faithful, Prajāpati, and Heavenly Grace bestow it.

column1: yayoḥ ojasā skabhitā rajāṃsi yau vīryaiḥ vīratamā śaviṣṭhā / yau patyete apratītau sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrvahūtiḥ /
column2: The early morning prayer hath come to Vishnu and Varuna, Lords through might, whom none hath equalled, Gods by whose power the realms of air were stablished, strongest and most heroic in their vigour.

column1: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate pra ca anati vi ca caṣṭe śacībhiḥ / purā devasya dharmaṇā sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrva hūtiḥ /
column2: The early prayer hath ever come to Vishnu and Varuna by that God's high power and statute. In whose control is all this world that shineth, all that hath powers to see and all that breatheth.

column1: viṣṇoḥ nu kam pra vocam vīryāṇi yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi / yaḥ askabhāyat uttaram sadhastham vicakramāṇaḥ tredhā uru gāyaḥ /
column2: I will declare the mighty deeds of Vishnu, of him who measured out the earthly regions, Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his footstep, widely striding.

column1: pra tat viṣṇuḥ stavate vīryāṇi mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ / parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ /
column2: Loud boast doth Vishnu make of this achievement, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming. May he approach us from the farthest distance.

column1: yasya uruṣu triṣu vikramaneṣu adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā / uru viṣṇo vi kramasva uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi / ghṛtam ghṛta yone piba prapra yajñapatim tira / idam viṣṇuḥ vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padā / samūḍham asya paṃsure / trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ / itas dharmāṇi dhārayan //
column2: Thou within whose three wide-extended paces all worlds and creatures have their habitation, Drink oil, thou homed in oil! promote the sacrificer more and more. Through all this world strode Vishnu: thrice his foot he planted, and the whole Was gathered in his footstep's dust.

column1: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā /
column2: Look ye on Vishnu's works, whereby the friend of Indra, close- allied, Hath let his holy ways be seen.
