column2: In whom Virāj, Prajāpati, Parameshthin, Agni Vaisvānara abide with Pankti, He who hath taken to himself the breathing of the Supreme, the vigour of the Highest, This God, etc. On whom rest six expenses and five regions, four waters, and three syllables of worship, He who hath looked between both spheres in anger, This God, etc.

column1: nimrucaḥ tisraḥ vyuṣaḥ ha tisraḥ trīṇi rajāṃsi divaḥ aṅga tisraḥ / vidma te agne tredhā janitram tredhā devānām janimāni vidma / tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti / vi yaḥ aurṇot pṛthivīm jāyamānaḥ ā samudram adadhāt antarikṣe / tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti / ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān //
column2: He who, consuming food, became its master, the Lord of Prayer, the Regent of Devotion, The world's Lord, present and to be hereafter, This God, etc. He who metes out the thirteenth month, constructed with days and nights, containing thirty members, This God, etc.

column1: saḥ eti savitā svar divaḥ pṛṣṭhe avacākaśat // raśmibhiḥ nabhaḥ ābhṛtam mahendraḥ eti āvṛtaḥ // sa dhātā sa vidhartā sa vāyuḥ nabhaḥ ucchritam //
column2: Dark the descent; the strong-winged birds are golden: they fly aloft to heaven, enrobed in waters. They have come hither from the seat of Order, This God, etc.

column1: na pañcamaḥ na ṣaṣṭhaḥ saptamaḥ na api ucyate // na aṣṭamaḥ na navamaḥ daśamaḥ na api ucyate // sa sarvasmai vi paśyati yat ca prāṇati yat ca na //
column2: What silver. Kasyapa, thou hast refulgent, what brightly-shining lotus-flower collected, Wherein are gathered seven Suns together, This God, etc.

column1: brahma ca tapaḥ ca kīrtiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca ambhaḥ ca nabhaḥ ca brāhmaṇa varcasam ca annam ca annādyam ca // bhūtam ca bhavyam ca śraddhā ca ruciḥ ca svargaḥ ca svadhā ca /
column2: In front the Brihat-Sāman is his mantle, and from behind Rathantara enfolds him, Ever with care robing themselves in splendour. This God, etc.

column1: yaḥ etam devam ekavṛtam veda // saḥ eva mṛtyuḥ saḥ amṛtam saḥ abhvam sa rakṣaḥ // sa rudraḥ vasuvaniḥ vasu deye namovāke vaṣaṭkāraḥ anu saṃhitaḥ //
column2: One of his wings was Brihat, and the other Rathantarr., vigorous with one same purpose, What time the Gods gave Rohita his being. This God, etc.

column1: sa vai antarikṣāt ajāyata tasmāt antarikṣam ajāyata // sa vai vāyoḥ ajāyata tasmāt vāyuḥ ajāyata // sa vai divaḥ ajāyata tasmāt dyauḥ adhi ajāyata // sa vai digbhyaḥ ajāyata tasmāt diśaḥ ajāyanta /
column2: At evening he is Varuna and Agni, ascending in the morning he is Mitra. As Savitar, he moves through air's mid region, as Indra warms- the heavens from the centre. This God, etc.

column1: sa stanayati sa vi dyotate saḥ u aśmānam asyati // pāpāya vā bhadrāya vā puruṣāya asurāya vā // yat vā kṛṇoṣi oṣadhīḥ yat vā varṣasi bhadrayā yat vā janyam avīvṛdhaḥ // tāvān te maghavan mahimā upa u te tanvaḥ śatam //
column2: This gold-hued Harisa's wings, soaring to heaven spread o'er a thousand days' continued journey. Supporting all the Gods upon his bosom, he goes his way behol- ding every creature. This God, etc.

column1: prathaḥ varaḥ vyacaḥ lokaḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam // bhavat vasuḥ idat vasuḥ saṃyat vasuḥ āyat vasuḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam //
column2: This is the God who dwells-within the waters, the thousand- rooted, many-powered Atri, He who brought all this world into existence. This God; etc.

column1: cittiḥ āḥ upabarhaṇam cakṣuḥ āḥ abhyañjanam / dyauḥ bhūmiḥ kośe āsīt yat ayāt sūryā patim / raibhī āsīt anudeyī nārāśaṃsī nyocanī / suryāyāḥ bhadram id vāsaḥ gāthayati pariṣkṛtā / stomāḥ āsan pratidhayaḥ kurīram chandaḥ opaśaḥ / sūryāyāḥ aśvinā varā agniḥ āsīt purogavaḥ / somaḥ vadhūyuḥ abhavat aśvinā āstām ubhā varā / sūryām yat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitā adadāt /
column2: With flying feet his tawny coursers carry the bright God through, the sky, aglow with splendour. Whose limbs uplifted fire and heat the heavens: hither he shines- with beams of golden colour. This God, etc. He beside whom his bay steeds bear the Ādityas, by whom as sacrifice go many knowing. The sole light shining spread through various places. This God, etc.

column1: sūryāyāḥ vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat / maghāsu hanyante gāvaḥ phalgunīṣu vi uhyate / yat aśvinā pṛchamānau ayātam tri cakreṇa vahatum sūryāyāḥ / kva ekam cakram vām āsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ // yat ayātam śubhaḥ patī vareyam sūryām upa / viśve devāḥ anu tat vām ajānan putraḥ pitaram avṛṇīta pūṣā / dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇaḥ ṛtuthā viduḥ / atha ekam cakram yat guhā tat addhātayaḥ id viduḥ /
column2: This seven make the one-wheeled chariot ready: bearing seven names the single courser draws it. The wheel, three-naved, is sound and undecaying: thereon these worlds of life are all dependent. This God, etc. Eight times attached the potent Courser draws it, Sire of the Gods, father of hymns and praises. So Mātarisvan, measuring in spirit the thread of Order, purifies all regions. This God, etc.

column1: saḥ id tat syonam harati brahmā vāsaḥ su maṅgalam / prāyaścittim yaḥ adhyeti yena jāyā na riṣyati // // //
column2: The thread that goes through all celestial quarters within the Gāyatri, womb of life eternal. This God, etc.

column1: somasya jāyā prathamam gandharvaḥ te aparaḥ patiḥ / tṛtīyaḥ agniḥ te patiḥ turīyaḥ te manuṣya jāḥ / somaḥ dadat gandharvāya gandharvaḥ dadat agnaye / rayim ca putrān ca adāt agniḥ mahyam atha u imām /
column2: There are the settings, three the upward risings, three are the- spaces, yea, and three the heavens. We know thy triple place of birth, O Agni, we know the deities'' triple generations.

column1: yāḥ oṣadhayaḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ yāni kṣetrāṇi yāḥ vanā / tāḥ tvā vadhu prajāvatīm patye rakṣantu rakṣasaḥ /
column2: He who, as soon as born, laid broad earth open, and set the ocean in the air's mid-region, This God, etc.

column1: ud vaḥ ūrmiḥ śamyā hantu āpaḥ yoktrāṇi muñcata / mā aduṣkṛtau vyenasau aghnyau aśunam āratām / aghora cakṣuḥ a pati ghnī syonā śagmā su śevā su yamā gṛhebhyaḥ / vīrasūḥ devṛ kāmā sam tvayā edhiṣīmahi sumasyamānā /
column2: Thou, Agni, kind with lights and mental powers, hast up in heaven shone as the Sun, enkindled. The Maruts, sons of Prisni, sang his praises what time the Gods gave Rohita his being. This God, etc.

column1: syonā bhava śvaśurebhyaḥ syonā patye gṛhebhyaḥ / syonā asyai sarvasyai viśe syonā puṣṭāya eṣām bhava /
column2: Giver of breath, giver of strength and vigour, he whose com- mandment all the Gods acknowledge, He who is Lord of this, of man and cattle, This God, etc.

column1: ud tiṣṭha itas viśvāvaso namasā iḍāmahe tvā / jāmim icha pitṛṣadam nyaktām sa te bhāgaḥ januṣā tasya viddhi / apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca / tāḥ te janitram abhi tāḥ parehi namaḥ te gandharva ṛtunā kṛṇomi // namaḥ gandharvasya namase namaḥ bhāmāya cakṣuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ / viśvāvaso brahmaṇā te namaḥ abhi jāyāḥ apsarasaḥ parehi /
column2: The single-footed hath outstepped the biped, the biped overtakes the triple-footed. The quadruped hath wrought when bipeds called him, standing and looking on the five collected. This God is wroth offended by the sinner that wrongs the Brāhman who hath gained this knowledge. Agitate him, O Rohita; destroy him: entangle in thy snares the Brāhman's tyrant.

column1: sam pitarau ṛtviye sṛjethām mātā pitā ca retasaḥ bhavāthaḥ / maryaḥ iva yoṣām adhi rohaya enām prajām kṛṇvāthām iha puṣyatam rayim //
column2: Born is the darksome Mother's Son, the whitely shining Calf of Night. He, Rohita, ascendeth up to heaven, hath mounted to the heights.

column1: vrātyaḥ āsīt īyamānaḥ eva sa prajāpatim sam airayat //
column2: There was a roaming Vrātya. He roused Prajāpati to action.

column1: sa prajāpatiḥ suvarṇam ātman apaśyat tat prājanayat //
column2: Prajāpati beheld gold in himself and engendered it.

column1: # tat ekam abhavat tat lalāmam abhavat tat mahat abhavat tat jyeṣṭham abhavat tat brahma abhavat tat tapaḥ abhavat tat satyam abhavat | tat satyam abhavat | tat satyam abhavat | tat | tat satyam abhavat |
column2: That became unique, that became distinguished, that became great, that became excellent, that became Devotion, that be- came holy Fervour, that became Truth: through that he was born.

column1: saḥ avardhata sa mahān abhavat sa mahādevaḥ abhavat //
column2: He grew, he became great, he became Mahādeva.

column1: sa devānām īśām pari ait saḥ īśānaḥ abhavat //
column2: He gained the lordship of the Gods. He became Lord.

column1: saḥ eka vrātyaḥ abhavat sa dhanuḥ ādatta tat eva indradhanuḥ //
column2: He became Chief Vrātya. He held a bow, even that Bow of Indra.

column1: nīlam asya udaram lohitam pṛṣṭham //
column2: His belly is dark-blue, his back is red.

column1: nīlena eva apriyam bhrātṛvyam prorṇoti lohitena dviṣantam vidhyati iti brahma vādinaḥ vadanti //
column2: With dark-blue he envelops a detested rival, with red he pierces the man who hates him: so the theologians say.

column1: sa saṃvatsaram ūrdhvaḥ atiṣṭhat tam devāḥ abruvan vrātya kim nu tiṣṭhasi iti // saḥ abravīt āsandīm me sam bharantu iti //
column2: For a whole year he stood erect. The Gods said unto him, Why standest thou, O Vrātya? He answered and said, Let them bring my couch.

column1: tasmai vrātyāya āsandīm sam abharan //
column2: They brought the couch for that Vrātya.

column1: tasyāḥ grīṣmaḥ ca vasantaḥ ca dvau pādau āstām śarad ca varṣāḥ ca dvau //
column2: Two of its feet were Summer and Spring, and two were Autumn and the Rains.

column1: bṛhat ca rathantaram ca anūcye āstām yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca tiraścye // ṛcaḥ prāñcaḥ tantavaḥ yajūṃṣi tiryañcaḥ / vedaḥ āstaraṇam brahma upabarhaṇam //
column2: Brihat and Rathantara were the two long boards, Yajnāyajniya and Vāmadevya the two cross-boards. Holy verses were the strings lengthwise, and Yajus formulas the cross-tapes.

column1: sāma āsādaḥ udgīthaḥ apaśrayaḥ //
column2: The Sāman was the Cushion, and chanting the bolster.

column1: tām āsandīm vrātyaḥ ārohat //
column2: The Vrātya ascended that couch.

column1: tasya deva janāḥ pariṣkandāḥ āsan saṃkalpāḥ prahāyyāḥ viśvāni bhūtāni upasadaḥ //
column2: The hosts of Gods were his attendants, solemn vows his messengers, and all creatures his worshippers.

column1: viśvāni eva asya bhūtāni upasadaḥ bhavanti yaḥ evam veda // tasmai prācyāḥ diśaḥ / [1]
column2: All creatures become the worshippers of him who possesses this knowledge.

column1: tasmai dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ / / / / / / / / / / tasmai dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / graiṣmau māsau goptārau akurvan yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca anuṣṭhātārau / [5] graiṣmau enam māsau dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // [6]
column2: For him they made the two Spring months protectors from the eastern region, and Brihat and Rathantara superintendents. The two Spring months protect from the eastern region, and Brihat and Rathantara superintend, the man who possesses this knowledge. For him they made the two Summer months pro- tectors from the southern region, and Yajnāyajniya and Vāmadevya superintendents. The two Summer months, etc. as in Verse 1,

column1: vārṣikau māsau goptārau akurvan vairūpam ca vairājam ca anuṣṭhātārau / [8]
column2: They made the two Rain months, his protectors from the western region, and Vairūpa and Vairaja superintendents. The two Rain months, etc. as above.

column1: śāradau māsau goptārau akurvam śyaitam ca naudhasam ca anuṣṭhātārau / [11] śāradau enam māsau udīcyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ śyaitam ca naudhasam ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // | [12]
column2: They made the two Autumn months his protectors from the northern region, and Syaita and Naudhasa superintendents. The two Autumn months. etc. as above.

column1: haimanau māsau goptārau akurvan bhūmim ca agnim ca anuṣṭhātārau / [14] haimanau enam māsau dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ bhūmiḥ ca agniḥ ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // | [15]
column2: They made the two Winter months his protectors from the region of the nadir, and earth and Agni superintendents. The two Winter months, etc.

column1: śaiśirau māsau goptārau akurvan divam ca ādityam ca anuṣṭhātārau / [17]
column2: They made the two Dewy months his protectors from the region of the zenith, and Heaven and the Ādityas superintendents. The two Dewy months, etc.

column1: tasmai prācyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt bhavam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [1] bhava enam iṣvāsaḥ prācyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān hinasti |
column2: For him they made the Archer Bhava a deliverer from the inter- mediate space of the eastern region. Bhava the Archer, a deliverer, delivers him from the intermediate space of the eastern region. Neither Sarva nor Bhava nor Isāna slays him who possesses this knowledge, or his cattle, or his kinsmen.

column1: # evam veda // // tasmai dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt śarvam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [4]
column2: They made Sarva the Archer his deliverer from the intermediate space of the southern region, etc, as in verse 1.

column1: tasmai pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt paśupatim iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [6]
column2: They made Pasupati the Archer his deliverer from the inter- mediate space of the western region, etc.

column1: tasmai udīcyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt ugram devam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [8]
column2: They made the Awful God, the Archer, his deliverer from the intermediate space of the northern region, etc, as above.

column1: tasmai dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt rudram iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [10]
column2: They made Rudra the Archer his deliverer from the intermediate space of the region of the nadir etc.

column1: tasmai ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt mahādevam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [12]
column2: They made Mahādeva his deliverer from the intermediate space of the region of the zenith, etc.

column1: yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // yaḥ evam veda // |/ [13] tasmai sarvebhyaḥ antardeśebhyaḥ īśānam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan / [14] īśānaḥ enam iṣvāsaḥ sarvebhyaḥ antardeśebhyaḥ anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān |
column2: They made Isana the Archer his deliverer from all the inter- mediate regions. Isāna the Archer, a deliverer, delivers him from all the intermediate regions. Neither Sarva nor Bhava, nor Isana slays him who possesses this knowledge, or his cattle, or his kinsmen.

column1: tam bhūmiḥ ca agniḥ ca oṣadhayaḥ ca vanaspatayaḥ ca vānaspatyāḥ ca vīrudhaḥ ca anuvyacalan / [2] bhūmeḥ ca vai saḥ agneḥ ca oṣadhīnām ca vanaspatīnām ca vānaspatyānām ca vīrudhām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda / priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda / priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda / priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda / priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda / priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
column2: He went his way to the region of the nadir. Earth and Agni and herbs and trees and shrubs and plants followed him. He who possesses this knowledge becomes the dear home of Earth and Agni and herbs and trees and shrubs and plants.

column1: saḥ ūrdhvām diśam anu vi acalat / [4] tam ṛtam ca satyam ca sūryaḥ ca candraḥ ca nakṣatrāṇi ca anuvyacalan / [5]
column2: He went his way to the region of the zenith. Right and Truth and Sun and Moon and Stars followed him. He who possesses this knowledge becomes, etc., as in verse 1. mutatis mutandis.

column1: tam ṛcaḥ ca sāmāni ca yajūṃṣi ca brahma ca anuvyacalan / [8]
column2: He went away to the last region. Richas, Sāmans Yajus formulas and Devotion followed him. He who, etc., as above.

column1: sa bṛhatīm diśam anu vi acalat / / [10] tam itihāsaḥ ca purāṇam ca gāthāḥ ca nārāśaṃsīḥ ca anuvyacalan / [11]
column2: He went away to the great region. Itihāsa and Purāna and Gāthās and Nārāsansis followed him. He who, etc.

column1: tam āhavanīyaḥ ca gārhapatyaḥ ca dakṣiṇāgniḥ ca yajñaḥ ca yajamānaḥ ca paśavaḥ ca anuvyacalan / [14] āhavanīyasya ca vai sa gārhapatyasya ca dakṣiṇāgneḥ ca yajñasya ca yajamānasya ca paśūnām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam |
column2: He went away to the supreme region. The Ēhavaniya, Gārha- patya, and Southern Fires, and Sacrifice, and Sacrificer, and sacrificial victims followed him. He who, etc.

column1: saḥ an ādiṣṭām diśam anu vi acalat / [16] tam ṛtavaḥ ca ārtavāḥ ca lokāḥ ca laukyāḥ ca māsāḥ ca ardha māsāḥ ca ahorātre ca anuvyacalan / [17] ṛtūnām ca vai saḥ ārtavānām ca lokānām ca laukyānām ca māsānām ca ardha māsānām ca ahorātrayoḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam | ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam |
column2: He went away to the unindicated region. The Seasons, groups of seasons, the worlds and their inhabitants, the months and half-months, and Day and Night followed him. He who, etc.

column1: saḥ an āvṛttām diśam anu vi acalat tatas na āvartsyan amanyata / / [19] tam ditiḥ ca aditiḥ ca iḍā ca indrāṇī ca anuvyacalan / [20]
column2: He went away to the unfrequented region. Thence he thought that he should not return. Diti and Aditi and Idā and Indrāni followed him. He who, etc.

column1: sa diśaḥ anu vi acalat tam virāj anu vi acalat sarve ca devāḥ sarvāḥ ca devatāḥ / [22]
column2: He went away to the regions. Virāj and all the Gods and all the Deities followed him. He who, etc.

column2: He went away to all the intermediate spaces. Prajāpati and Parameshthin and the Father and the Great Father followed him. He who possesses this knowledge becomes the beloved home of Prajāpati and Parameshthin and the Father and the Great Father.

column1: sa mahimā sadruḥ bhūtvā antam pṛthivyāḥ agacchat samudraḥ abhavat //
column2: He, having become moving majesty, went to the ends of the earth. He became the sea.

column1: tam prajāpatiḥ ca parameṣṭhī ca pitā ca pitāmahaḥ ca apaḥ ca śraddhā ca varṣam bhūtvā anuvyavartayanta /
column2: Prajāpati and Parameshthin and the Father and the Great Father and the Waters and Faith, turned into rain, followed him.

column1: ā enam āpaḥ gacchanti ainam śraddhā gachati a enam varṣam gachati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: The Waters, Faith, and rain approach him who possesses this knowledge.

column1: tam śraddhā ca yajñaḥ ca lokaḥ ca annam ca annādyam ca bhūtvā abhiparyāvartanta //
column2: Faith, and Sacrifice and the world, having become food and nourishment, turned toward him.

column1: ā enam śraddhā gacchati ainam yajñaḥ gachati ainam lokaḥ gacchati ainam annam gachati ainam annādyam gacchati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: Faith Sacrifice, the world, food and nourishment approach him who possesses this knowledge.

column1: saḥ arajyata tatas rājanyaḥ ajāyata //
column2: He was filled with passion: from him sprang the Rājanya.

column1: sa viśaḥ sabandhūn annam annādyam abhyudatiṣṭhat //
column2: He came to the people, to kinsmen, food and nourishment.

column1: viśām ca vai sa sabandhūnām ca annasya ca annādyasya ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: He who possesses this knowledge becomes the dear home of the people, kinsmen, food and nourishment.

column1: sa viśaḥ anu vi acalat //
column2: He went away to the people.

column1: tam sabhā ca samitiḥ ca senā ca surā ca anuvyacalan //
column2: Meeting and Assembly and Army and Wine followed him.

column1: sabhāyāḥ ca vai sa samiteḥ ca senāyāḥ ca surāyāḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: He who hath this knowledge becomes the dear home of Meeting, Assembly, Army, and Wine.

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ rājñaḥ atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet //
column2: So let the King, to whose house the Vrātya who possesses this knowledge comes as a guest.

column1: śreyāṃsam enam ātmanaḥ mānayet tathā kṣatrāya na ā vṛścate tathā rāṣṭrāya na vṛścate /
column2: Honour him as superior to himself. So he Both not act against the interests of his princely rank or his kingdom.

column1: atas vai brahma ca kṣatram ca ud atiṣṭhatām te abrūtām kam pra viśāva iti //
column2: From him, verily, sprang Priesthood and Royalty. They said, Into whom shall we enter?

column1: bṛhaspatim eva brahma praviśatu indram kṣatram tathā vai iti // atas vai bṛhaspatim eva brahma prāviśat indram kṣatram /
column2: Let Priesthood enter into Brihaspati, and Royalty into Indra, was the answer. Hence Priesthood entered into Brihaspati and Royalty into Indra.

column1: iyam vai u pṛthivī bṛhaspatiḥ dyauḥ eva indraḥ //
column2: Now this Earth is Brihaspati, and Heaven is Indra.

column1: ayam vai u agniḥ brahmā asau ādityaḥ kṣatram //
column2: Now this Agni is Priesthood, and yonder Sun is Royalty.

column1: ā enam brahma gacchati brahmavarcasī bhavati //
column2: Priesthood comes to him, and he becomes endowed with priestly lustre.

column1: yaḥ pṛthivīm bṛhaspatim agnim brahma veda //
column2: Who knows that Earth is Brihaspati and Agni Priesthood.

column1: ā enam indriyam gacchati indriyavān bhavati //
column2: Great power comes to him and he becomes endowed with great power.

column1: yaḥ ādityam kṣatram divam indram veda //
column2: Who knows that Āditya is Royalty and that Heaven is Indra.

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet //
column2: Let him to whose house the Vrātya who possesses this knowledge comes as a guest.

column1: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya kva avātsīḥ vrātya udakam vrātya vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu vrātya
column2: Rise up of his own accord to meet him, and say, Vrātya, where didst thou pass the night? Vratya, here is water, Let them refresh thee. Vrātya, let it be as thou pleasest. Vrātya, as thy wish is so let it be. Vrātya, as thy desire is so be it.

column1: te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti // // yat enam āha vrātya kva avātsīḥ iti pathaḥ eva tena deva yānān ava rundhe //
column2: When he says to his guest, Where didst thou pass the night? he reserves for himself thereby the paths that lead to the Gods.

column1: yat enam āha vrātya udakam iti apaḥ eva tena ava rundhe //
column2: When he says to him, Here is water, he secures thereby water for himself.

column1: yat enam āha vrātya tarpayantu iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute //
column2: When he says to him, Let them refresh thee, he thereby wins vital breath to exceeding old age.

column1: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu iti priyam eva tena ava rundhe //
column2: When he says to him, Vrātya, let it be as thou pleasest, he secures to himself thereby what is pleasant.

column1: ā enam priyam gacchati priyaḥ priyasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: That which is pleasant comes to him, and he is the beloved of the beloved, who is possessed of this knowledge.

column1: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu iti vaśam eva tena ava rundhe //
column2: When he says to him, Vrātya, as thy will is so let it be, he secures to himself thereby the fulfilment of his will.

column1: ā enam vaśaḥ gacchati vaśī vaśinām bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: Authority comes to him who possesses this knowledge, and he becomes the controller of the powerful.

column1: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti nikāmam eva tena ava rundhe //
column2: When he says to him, Vrātya, as thy desire is so be it, he secures to himself thereby the attainment of his desire.

column1: ā enam nikāmaḥ gacchati nikāme nikāmasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
column2: His desire comes to him who possesses this knowledge and he gains the complete satisfaction of his wish.

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ uddhṛteṣu agniṣu adhiśrite agnihotre atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet //
column2: The man, to whose house, when the fires have been taken up from the hearth and the oblation to Agni placed therein, the Vrātya possessing this knowledge comes as a guest.

column1: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya ati sṛja hoṣyāmi iti //
column2: Should of his own accord rise to meet him and say, Vrātya, give me permission. I will sacrifice.

column1: sa ca atisṛjet juhuyāt na ca atisṛjet na juhuyāt //
column2: And if he gives permission he should sacrifice, if he does not permit him he should not sacrifice.

column1: sa yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
column2: He who sacrifices when permitted by the Vrātya who possesses this knowledge.

column1: pra pitṛ yāṇam panthām jānāti pra deva yānam //
column2: Well knows the path that leads to the Fathers and the way that. leads to the Gods.

column1: na deveṣu ā vṛścate hutam asya bhavati //
column2: He does not act in opposition to the Gods. It becomes his sacrifice.

column1: pari asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
column2: The abode of the man who sacrifices when permitted by the Vrātya who possesses this knowledge is long left remaining in this world.

column1: atha yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
column2: But he who sacrifices without the permission of the Vrātya who- possesses this knowledge.

column1: na pitṛ yāṇam panthām jānāti na deva yānam // ā deveṣu vṛścate a hutam asya bhavati //
column2: Knows not the path that leads to the Fathers nor the way that leads to the Gods.

column1: na asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
column2: The abode of the man who sacrifices without the permission of the Vrātya who possesses this knowledge is not left remaining in this world.

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ ekām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati / [1] ye pṛthivyām puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe // [2] tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ dvitīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati / [3]
column2: He in whose house the Vrātya who possesses this knowledge abides one night secures for himself thereby the holy realms that are on earth. A second night . . . . the holy realms that are in the firma- ment (the rest as in verse 1).

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ tṛtīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati / [5]
column2: A third night . . . the holy realms that are in heaven.

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ caturthīm rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati / [7]
column2: A fourth night . . . . the holy realms of the Holy.

column1: ye puṇyānām puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe // [8]
column2: Unlimited nights . . . . unlimited holy realms.

column1: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ aparimitāḥ rātrīḥ atithiḥ gṛhe vasati / [9]
column2: Now he to whose house a non-Vrātya, calling himself a Vrātya, and one in name only, comes as a guest.

column1: karṣet enam na ca enam karṣet // [12]
column2: Should punish him and not punish him.
He should serve him with food saying to himself, To this Deity I offer water: I lodge this Deity; I wait upon this, this Deity.
To that Deity the sacrifice of him who has this knowledge is acceptable.

column1: sa yat prācīm diśam anu vyacalat mārutam śardhaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manaḥ anna adam kṛtvā / [1]
column2: He when he went away to the eastern region, went away having become the Marut host, and having made Mind an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with Mind as food-eater.

column1: sa yat dakṣiṇām diśam anu vyacalat indraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat balam anna adam kṛtvā / [3]
column2: He, when he went away to the southern region, went away having become Indra, and having made Strength an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with strength as food-eater.
He, when he went away to the western region, went away having become King Varuna, and having made the Waters eaters of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with the Waters as food-eaters.

column1: sa yat udīcīm diśam anu vyacalat somaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat saptarṣibhiḥ hute āhutim annādīm kṛtvā / [7]
column2: He, when he went away to the northern region, went away having become King Soma and having made the Seven Rishis' oblation an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with oblation as food-eater.

column1: sa yat dhruvām diśam anu vyacalat viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat virājam annādīm kṛtvā / / [9]
column2: He, when he went away to the stedfast region, went away having become Vishnu and having made Virāj an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with Virāj as food-eater.

column1: sa yat paśūn anu vyacalat rudraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat oṣadhīḥ anna ādīḥ kṛtvā / / [11]
column2: He, when he went away to animals, went away having become Rudra and having made herbs eaters of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with herbs as food-eaters.

He, when he went away to the Fathers, went away having be- come King Yama and having made the exclamation Svadhā an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with the exclamation Svadhā as food-eater.
He, when he went away to men, went away having become Agni and having made the exclamation Svāhā an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with the exclamation Svahā as food-eater.

He, when he went away to the upper region, went away having become Brihaspati and having made the exclamation Vashat an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with the exclamation Vashat as food-eater.

column1: sa yat devān anu vyacalat īśānaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manyum anna adam kṛtvā / / [19]
column2: He, when he went away to the Gods, went away having become Isana and having made Passion an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with Passion as food-eater.
He, when he went away to creatures, went away having become Prajāpati and having made vital breath an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with vital breath as foodeater.
He, when he went away to all the intermediate spaces, went away having become Parameshthin and having made Devotion an eater of food. He who hath this knowledge eats food with Devotion as food-eater.

column1: tasya vrātyasya //
column2: Of that Vrātya.

column1: sapta prāṇāḥ sapta apānāḥ sapta vyānāḥ //
column2: There are seven vital airs, seven downward breaths, seven diff- used breaths.

column1: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ prāṇaḥ ūrdhvaḥ nāma ayam saḥ agniḥ //
column2: His first vital breath, called Upward, is this Agni.

column1: yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ prāṇaḥ prauḍhaḥ nāma asau saḥ ādityaḥ //
column2: His second vital breath, called Mature, is that Āditya.

column1: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ prāṇaḥ abhyūḍhaḥ nāma asau sa candramāḥ //
column2: His third vital breath, called Approached, is that Moon.

column1: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ prāṇaḥ vibhūḥ nāma ayam sa pavamānaḥ //
column2: His fourth vital breath, called Pervading is this Pavamāna.

column1: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ prāṇaḥ yoniḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ //
column2: His fifth vital breath, called Source, are these Waters.

column1: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ prāṇaḥ priyaḥ nāma te ime paśavaḥ //
column2: His sixth vital breath, called Dear, are these domestic animals.

column1: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ prāṇaḥ aparimitaḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ prajāḥ //
column2: His seventh vital breath, called Unlimited, are these creatures.

column1: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ apānaḥ sā paurṇamāsī //
column2: His first downward breath is the time of Full Moon.

column1: yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ apānaḥ sā aṣṭakā //
column2: His second downward breath is the eighth day after Full Moon.

column1: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ apānaḥ sā amāvāsyā //
column2: His third downward breath is the night of New Moon.

column1: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ apānaḥ sā śraddhā //
column2: His fourth downward breath is Faith.

column1: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ apānaḥ sā dīkṣā //
column2: His fifth downward breath is Consecration.

column1: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ apānaḥ sa yajñaḥ // yaḥ asya saptamaḥ apānaḥ tāḥ imāḥ dakṣiṇāḥ //
column2: His sixth downward breath is Sacrifice. His seventh downward breath are these sacrificial fees.

column1: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ vyānaḥ sā iyam bhūmiḥ //
column2: His first diffused breath is this Earth.

column1: yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ vyānaḥ tat antarikṣam // yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ vyānaḥ sā dyauḥ //
column2: His second diffused breath is that Firmament. His third diffused breath is that Heaven.

column1: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ vyānaḥ tāni nakṣatrāṇi //
column2: His fourth diffused breath are those Constellations.

column1: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ vyānaḥ te ṛtavaḥ //
column2: His fifth diffused breath are the Seasons.

column1: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ vyānaḥ te ārtavāḥ //
column2: His sixth diffused breath are the Season-groups.

column1: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ vyānaḥ sa saṃvatsaraḥ //
column2: His seventh diffused breath is the year.

column1: samānam artham pari yanti devāḥ saṃvatsaram vai etat ṛtavaḥ anupariyanti vrātyam ca //
column2: With one and the same object the Gods go round the Year and the Seasons follow round the Vrātya.

column1: yat ādityam abhisaṃviśanti amāvāsyām ca eva tat paurṇamāsīm ca //
column2: When they surround the Sun on the day of New Moon, and that time of Full Moon.

column1: ekam tat eṣām amṛta tvam iti āhutiḥ eva // tasya vrātyasya //
column2: That one immortality of theirs is just an oblation.

column1: atisṛṣṭaḥ apām vṛṣabhaḥ atisṛṣṭāḥ agnayaḥ divyāḥ //
column2: The Bull of the Waters hath been let go; the heavenly fires have been let go.

column1: rujan parirujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan // mrokaḥ manohā khanaḥ nirdāhaḥ ātma dūṣiḥ tanū dūṣiḥ //

column1: idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi //
column2: Here I let him go: thou washest me clean of him.

column1: tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ //
column2: With this we let him loose who hates us and whom we hate.

column1: apām agram asi samudram vaḥ abhyavasṛjāmi //
column2: Thou art in front of the waters. I let loose your sea.

column1: yaḥ apsu agniḥ ati tam sṛjāmi mrokam khanim tanū dūṣim // yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ agniḥ āviveśa saḥ eṣa yat vaḥ ghoram tat etat //
column2: I let loose the Agni who is within the waters, Mroka the up- rooter, the destroyer of the body. Your Agni who entered into the waters, even he here is that very dread of yours.

column1: indrasya vaḥ indriyeṇa abhi siñcet //
column2: May he anoint you with Indra's own mighty power!

column1: a riprāḥ āpaḥ apa ripram asmat // pra asmat enaḥ vahantu pra duṣvapnyam vahantu //
column2: May they carry sin away from us, may they carry away from us the evil dream.

column1: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me //
column2: Look on me with a friendly eye, O, Waters, and touch my skin with your auspicious body.

column1: śivān agnīn apsuṣadaḥ havāmahe mayi kṣatram varcaḥ ā dhatta devīḥ // niḥ durarmaṇyaḥ ūrjā madhumatī vāc //
column2: We call the gracious Fires that dwell in waters. Goddesses, grant me princely power and splendour.

column1: madhumatī stha madhumatīm vācam udeyam //
column2: Are pleasant. May I obtain a pleasant voice.

column1: upahūtaḥ me gopāḥ upahūtaḥ gopīthaḥ // su śrutau karṇau bhadra śrutau karṇau bhadram ślokam śrūyāsam //
column2: Quick of hearing are mine ears; mine ears hear what is good- Fain would I hear a pleasant sound.

column1: suśrutiḥ ca mā upaśrutiḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām sauparṇam cakṣuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ //
column2: Let not good hearing and overhearing fail the Eagle's eye, the undecaying light.

column1: ṛṣīṇām prastaraḥ asi namaḥ astu daivāya prastarāya //
column2: Thou art the couch of the Rishis. Let worship be paid to the divine couch.

column1: mūrdhā aham rayīṇām mūrdhā samānānām bhūyāsam //
column2: I am the head of riches. Fain would I be the head of mine equals.

column1: rujaḥ ca mā venaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām mūrdhā ca mā vidharmā ca mā hāsiṣṭām //
column2: Let not Ruja and Vena desert me. Let not the Head and the Preserver forsake me.

column1: urvaḥ ca mā camasaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām dhartā ca mā dharuṇaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām // vimokaḥ ca me ārdra paviḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām ārdra dānuḥ ca mā mātariśvā ca mā hāsiṣṭām //
column2: Let not the Boiler and the Cup fail tme: let not the Supporter and the Sustainer abandon me. Let not Unyoking and the Moist-fellied car desert me: let not the Sender of Moisture and Matarisvan forsake me.

column1: bṛhaspatiḥ me ātmā nṛmaṇāḥ nāma hṛdyaḥ //
column2: Brihaspati is my soul, he who is called the Friend of man, dear to my heart.

column1: asaṃtāpam me hṛdayam urvī gavyūtiḥ samudraḥ asmi vidharmaṇā //
column2: My heart is free from sorrow; spacious is my dwelling-place. I am the sea in capacity.

column1: nābhiḥ aham rayīṇām nābhiḥ samānānām bhūyāsam //
column2: I am the:centre of riches. Fain would I be the centre of mine equals.

column1: svāsat asi sūṣāḥ amṛtaḥ martya īśu ā //
column2: Pleasant art thou to sit by one, a mother: immortal among mortals.

column1: mā mām prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ avahāya parā gāt //
column2: Let not inward breath desert me; let not outward breath depart and leave me.

column1: sūryaḥ mā ahnaḥ pātu agniḥ pṛthivyāḥ vāyuḥ antarikṣāt yamaḥ manuṣyebhyaḥ sarasvatī pārthivebhyaḥ //
column2: Let Sūrya protect me from Day, Agni from Earth, Vāyu from Firmament, Yama from men, Sarasvatī from dwellers on the earth.

column1: prāṇa apanau mā mā hāsiṣṭam mā jane pra meṣi //
column2: Let not outward and inward breath fail me. Be not thou destruc- tive among the men.

column1: svasti adya uṣasaḥ doṣasaḥ ca sarve āpaḥ sarva gaṇaḥ aśīya //
column2: Propitious to-day be dawns and evenings. May I drink water with all my people safe around me.

column1: śakvarī stha paśavaḥ mā upa stheṣuḥ mitrāvaruṇau me prāṇa apānau agniḥ me dakṣam dadhātu /
column2: Mighty are ye, domestic creatures. May Mitra-Varuna stand beside me. May Agni give me inward and outward breath. May,he give me ability.

column1: vidma te svapna janitram grāhyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ / antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi / tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi // vidma te svapna janitram nirṛtyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ / / / // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
column2: We know thine origin, O Sleep. Thou art the son of Grahi, the minister of Yama. Thou art the Ender, thou art Death. As such, O Sleep, we know thee well. As such preserve us from the evil dream. We know thine origin, O Sleep. Thou art the son of Destruction, the minister of Yama, etc. (as in verse 1). We know thine origin, O Sleep. Thou art the son of Misery, etc. We know thine origin, O Sleep. Thou art the son of Disappear- ance, etc.

column1: vidma te svapna janitram abhūtyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya // 3 //
column2: We know thine origin, O Sleep. Thou art the son of Defeat etc.

column1: vidma te svapna janitram parābhūtyāḥ putraḥ asi // 5 // vidma te svapna janitram deva jāmīnām putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ / antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi / tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi //
column2: We know thine origin, O Sleep. Thou art the son of the sisters of the Gods, the minister of Yama. Thou art the Ender, thou are Death. As such, O Sleep, we know thee well. As such, preserve us from the evil dream.

column1: ajaiṣma adya āsanām adya amūm anāgasaḥ vayam //
column2: Now have we conquered and obtained: we have been freed from sin to-day.

column2: Let Morning with her light dispel that evil dream that frightened us.

column2: Bear that away to him who hates, away to him who curses us.

column1: te amuṣmai parā vahantu arāyān durṇāmnaḥ sadānvāḥ /
column2: Carry away to Such-an-one niggard fiends, hostile demons, and Sadanvas,

column1: kumbhīkāḥ dūṣīkāḥ pīyakān //
column2: Kumbhikas, Dushikas, and Piyakas,

column1: jāgrat duṣvapnyam svapneduṣvapnyam //
column2: Evil day-dream, evil dream in sleep,

column2: Wishes for boons that will not come, thoughts of poverty, the snares of the Druh who never releases.

column2: This, O Agni, let the Gods bear off to Such-an-one that he may be a fragile good-for-nothing eunuch.

column2: Herewith I pierce this man. With poverty I pierce him. With disappearance I pierce him. With defeat I pierce him. With Grāhi I pierce him. With darkness I pierce him.

column1: devānām enam ghoraiḥ krūraiḥ praiṣaiḥ abhipreṣyāmi //
column2: I summon him with the awful cruel orders of the Gods.

column1: vaiśvānarasya enam daṃṣṭrayoḥ api dadhāmi //
column2: I place him between Vaisvānara's jaws.

column1: eva an eva ava sā garat //
column2: Thus or otherwise let her swallow him up.

column2: Him who hates us may his soul hate, and may he whom we hate hate himself.

column1: niḥ dviṣantam divaḥ niḥ pṛthivyāḥ niḥ antarikṣāt bhajāma //
column2: We scorch out of heaven and earth and firmament the man who hates us.

column1: suyāman cākṣuṣa //
column2: Suyāman son of Chakshus.

column1: idam aham āmuṣyāyaṇe amuṣyāḥ putre duṣvapnyam mṛje //
column2: Here I wipe away the evil dream on the descendant of Such-an- one, son of Such-a-woman.

column1: yat adoadaḥ abhyagaccham yat doṣāḥ yat pūrvām rātrim //
column2: Whatsoever I have met with, whether at dusk or during early night,

column1: yat jāgrat yat suptaḥ yat divā yat naktam //
column2: Whether waking or sleeping, whether by day or by night.

column1: yat aharahar abhigacchāmi tasmāt enam ava daye //
column2: Whether I meet with it day by day, from that do I bribe him away.

column1: tam jahi tena mandasva tasya pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇīhi //
column2: Slay him; rejoice in this; crush his ribs.

column1: sa mā jīvīt tam prāṇaḥ jahātu //
column2: Let him not live. Let the breath of life forsake him.

Let him not be freed from the noose of Grāhi. Here I bind up his splendour, his energy, his vital breath, his life, and cast him down beneath me.

column2: Whatever we have gained, whatever hath accrued to us, our Right, our energy, our Devotion, our heavenly light, our sacrifice, our domestic animals, our offspring, our men,—from all share herein we exclude Such-as-one, descendant of Such- an-one, son of Such-a-woman. Let him not be freed from the fetter and noose of Death. Here I bind up his splendour, his energy, his vital breath, his life, and cast him down beneath me. Let the streams flow together, let the winds and birds assembled come. Strengthen this sacrifice of mine, ye singers. I offer up a duly mixt oblation.

column1: pitṛbhyaḥ somavadbhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ // yamāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ // etat te pratatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu // etat te tatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu //
column2: O Burnt Oblations, aid, and ye, Blent Offerings, this my sacrifice. Strengthen this sacrifice of mine, ye singers. I offer up a duly mixt oblation.

column1: rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ saṃrabhya enam pari svaje / yajñam imam catasraḥ pradiśaḥ vardhayantu saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi //
column2: Each several form, each several force I seize, and compass round this man. May the Four Quarters strengthen this my sacrifice. I offer up a duly mixt oblation.

column1: śam te āpaḥ haimavatīḥ śam u te santu utsyāḥ / śam te saniṣyadāḥ āpaḥ śam u te santu varṣyāḥ //
column2: Blest be the Streams from hills of snow, sweet be spring Waters unto thee. Sweet be swift-running Waters, sweet to thee be Water of the Rains.

column1: śam te āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam te santu anūpyāḥ / śam te khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam yāḥ kumbhebhiḥ ābhṛtāḥ //
column2: Sweet unto thee be Waters of the waste and Waters of the pool. Sweet be the Waters dug from earth, to thee, and Waters brought in jars.

column1: anabhrayaḥ khanamānāḥ viprāḥ gambhīre apasaḥ / bhiṣagbhyaḥ bhiṣaktarāḥ āpaḥ achā vadāmasi //
column2: To those who delve without a tool to dig, the wise, the deeply moved, To Waters better healers than physicians we address our prayer.

column1: apām aha divyānām apām srotasyānām / apām aha praṇejane aśvāḥ bhavatha vājinaḥ /
column2: Bathed in the Waters verily divine, in water of the streams, Bathed in the Waters verily, O Horses, be ye fleet and strong.

column1: tāḥ apaḥ śivāḥ apaḥ a yakṣmaṃkaraṇīḥ apaḥ / yathā eva tṛpyate mayaḥ tāḥ te ā datta bhesajīḥ //
column2: Blest be the Waters unto thee, suspicious Waters, bringing. health. They cure the injured place for thee even as thy comfort craveth it.

column1: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt vanaspatibhyaḥ adhi oṣadhībhyaḥ / yatra yatra vibhṛtaḥ jātavedāḥ tatas stutaḥ juṣamāṇaḥ naḥ ehi //
column2: Whithersoe'er, from sky, earth, air's mid-regions from plants ands herbs, from tall trees, Jātavedas. Is carried here and there to divers places, even thence come thou to us with loving-kindness.

column1: yaḥ te apsu mahimā yaḥ vaneṣu yaḥ oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar / agne sarvāḥ tanvaḥ sam rabhasva tābhiḥ naḥ ehi draviṇaḥ dāḥ ajasraḥ /
column2: All majesty of thine in floods, in forest, in plants, in cattle, in the depths of waters Closely uniting all thy forms, O Agni, come unto us wealth-giv- ing, undecaying.

column1: yaḥ te deveṣu mahimā svargaḥ yā te tanuḥ pitṛṣu āviveśa / puṣṭiḥ yā te manuṣyeṣu paprathe agne tayā rayim asmāsu dhehi //
column2: Thy majesty among the Gods in Svarga, thy body which hath past into the Fathers. Thy plenty far-diffused mid human beings, even with this, O Agni, give us riches.

column1: śrutkarṇāya kavaye vedyāya vacobhiḥ vākaiḥ upa yāmi rātim / yatas bhayam abhayam tat naḥ astu ava devānām yaja heḍaḥ agne /
column2: To him the wise, the famous, swift to listen, with words and verses I come nigh for bounty. May we be safe from threatening danger. Soften by sacrifice the- wrath of Gods, O Agni.

column1: yām āhutim prathamām atharvā yā jātā yā havyam akṛṇot jātavedāḥ / tām te etām prathamaḥ johavīmi tābhiḥ tuptaḥ vahatu havyam agniḥ agnaye svāhā /
column2: The first oblation that Atharvan oared, earliest sacrifice paid by Jātavedas, Even this I, foremost, with repeated worship, now offer unto thee. May Agni carry the sacrificer's present. Hail to Agni!

column1: ākūtim devīm subhagām puras dadhe cittasya mātā su havā naḥ astu / yām āśām emi kevalī sā me astu videyam enām manasi praviṣṭām /
column2: In front I set Intention, blessed Goddess. Mother of thought, may she be prompt to hear us. Mine, and mine only, be the hope I fashion! May I gain this that hath possessed my spirit.

column1: ākūtyā naḥ bṛhaspate ākūtyā naḥ upa ā gahi / atha u bhagasya naḥ dhehi atha u naḥ su havaḥ bhava /
column2: With Purpose, O Prajāpati, with Purpose come thou near to us. Bestow on us a share of luck, and so be swift to hear our call.

column1: bṛhaspatiḥ me ākūtim āṅgirasaḥ prati jānātu vācam etām / yasya devāḥ devatāḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ sa su praṇītāḥ kāmaḥ anu etu asmān /
column2: Prajāpati Angirasa with favour regard this word and this my settled purpose! May he, whence Gods and Deities had being Kāma attend us with his gentle guidance.

column1: indraḥ rājā jagataḥ carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpam yat asti / tatas dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codat rādhaḥ upastutaḥ cit arvāk / sahasra bāhuḥ puruṣaḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasrapād / sa bhūmim viśvatas vṛtvā ati atiṣṭhat daśa aṅgulam //
column2: King of the living world and men is Indra, of all in varied form that earth containeth. Thence to the worshipper he giveth riches: may he enrich even us when we have praised him.

column1: candramāḥ manasaḥ jātaḥ cakṣoḥ sūryaḥ ajāyata / mukhāt indraḥ ca agniḥ ca prāṇāt vāyuḥ ajāyata / nābhyāḥ āsīt antarikṣam śīrṣṇaḥ dyauḥ sam avartata / padbhyām bhūmiḥ diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokām akalpayan /
column2: The brilliant lights shining in heaven together, which through the world glide on with rapid motion. And Days, and Firmament with songs I worship, seeking the Twenty-eight-fold for its favour.

column1: citrāṇi sākam divi rocanāni sarīsṛpāṇi bhuvane javāni / turmiśam sumatim ichamānaḥ ahāni gīrbhiḥ saparyāmi nākam / su havam agne kṛttikā rohiṇī ca astu bhadram mṛgaśiraḥ śam ārdrā / punarvasū sūnṛtā cāru puṣyaḥ bhānuḥ āśleṣāḥ ayanam maghā me / puṇyam pūrvā phalgunyau ca atra hastaḥ citrā śivā svāti sukhaḥ me astu / rādhe viśākhe su havā anurādhā jyeṣṭhā su nakṣatram ariṣṭa mūlam /
column2: Krittikās, Rohinī be swift to hear me! Let Mrigasiras bless me, help me Ārdrā! Punarvasu and Sūnritā, fair Pushya, the Sun, Asleshās, Maghā lead me onward! My bliss be Svāti and benignant Chitrā, my right First Phalgunis and present Hasta. Rādhas, Visākhas, gracious Anurādhā, Jyeshthā and happy- starred uninjured Mūla.

column1: annam pūrvā rāsatām me aṣādhāḥ ūrjam devī uttarāḥ ā vahantu / abhijit me rāsatām puṇyam eva śravaṇaḥ śraviṣṭhāḥ kurvatām su puṣṭim / ā me mahat śatabhiṣaj varīyaḥ ā me dvayā proṣṭhapadā su śarma / ā revatī ca aśvayujau bhagam me ā me rayim bharaṇyaḥ ā vahantu /
column2: Food shall be earlier Ashādhas grant me; let those that follow bring me strength and vigour; With virtuous merit Abhijit endow me! Sravana and Sravishthās make me prosper. Satabhishak afford me ample freedom, and both the Proshtha- padas guard me safely. Revati and the Asvayujas bring me luck, and the Bharanis abundant riches!

column1: yāni nakṣatrāṇi divi antarikṣe apsu bhūmau yāni nageṣu dikṣu / prakalpayan candramāḥ yāni eti sarvāṇi mama etāni śivāni santu //
column2: Benign to me be all those Lunar Mansions to which the Moon as he moves on doth honour. All that are in the sky, the air, the waters, on earth, on moun- tains, in the heavenly regions.

column1: aṣṭāviṃśāni śivāni śagmāni saha yogam bhajantu me / yogam pra padye kṣemam ca kṣemam pra padye yogam ca namaḥ ahar rātrābhyām astu //
column2: Propitious, mighty, let the eight-and-twenty together deal me out my share of profit. Profit and wealth be mine, and wealth and profit! To Day and Night be adoration rendered!

column1: svastitam me su prātar su sāyam su divam su mṛgam su śakunam me astu / su havam agne svasti amartyam gatvā punar āya abhinandan //
column2: Fair be my sunset, fair my morn and evening and day with. lucky chase and happy omens; With blessing and success, immortal Agni, go to the mortal and. return rejoicing.

column1: anuhavam parihavam parivādam parikṣavam / sarvaiḥ me rikta kumbhān parā tān savitar suva //
column2: Excitement and invoking cry, ill-omened sneezing and reproof, All sounds of empty pitchers send into the distance, Savitar!

column1: apapāpam parikṣavam puṇyam bhakṣīmahi kṣavam / śivā te pāpa nāsikām puṇya gaḥ ca abhi mehatām /
column2: May we escape an evil sneeze, enjoy the sneeze of happy luck, And may our nostrils smelling what is pleasant pour forth fragrant scent.

column1: imāḥ yāḥ brahmaṇaḥ pate viṣucīḥ vāte īrate / sadhrīcīḥ indra tāḥ kṛtvā mahyam śivatamāḥ kṛdhi //
column2: These flames of Brāhmanaspati borne to all quarters in the- wind, Turn them all hither, Indra, and make them most gracious unto, me.

column1: svasti naḥ astu abhayam naḥ astu namaḥ ahar uratrābhyām astu // śāntā dyauḥ śāntā pṛthivī śāntam idam uru antarikṣam / śāntāḥ udanvatīḥ āpaḥ śāntāḥ naḥ santu oṣadhīḥ / śāntāni pūrvarūpāṇi śāntam naḥ astu kṛta akṛtam / śāntam bhūtam ca bhavyam ca sarvam eva śam astu naḥ /
column2: Gentle be heaven, gentle be earth, gentle this spacious, atmosphere. Gentle be waters as they flow, gentle to us be plants and herbs! Gentle be signs of coming change, and that which is and is not. done! Gentle be past and future, yea, let all be gracious unto us.

column1: iyam yā parameṣṭhinī vāc devī brahma saṃśitā / yayā eva sasṛje ghoram tayā eva śāntiḥ astu naḥ /
column2: Quickened by Prayer, this Goddess Vāk who standeth in the highest place, By whom the awful spell was made, even through her to us be peace!

column1: idam yat parameṣṭhinam manaḥ vām brahma saṃśitam / yena eva sasṛje ghoram tena eva śāntiḥ astu naḥ /
column2: Or, made more keen by Prayer, this mind that standeth in the highest place, Whereby the awful spell was made, even through this be peace to us!

column1: imāni yāni pañca indriyāni manaḥ ṣaṣṭhāni me hṛdi brahmaṇā saṃśitāni / yaiḥ eva sasṛje ghoram taiḥ eva śāntiḥ astu naḥ /
column2: These five sense-organs with the mind as sixth, sharpened by Prayer, abiding in my heart, By which the awful spell was made, even by these be peace to us.

column1: śam naḥ mitraḥ śam varuṇaḥ śam viṣṇuḥ śam prajāpatiḥ / śam naḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ śam naḥ bhavatu aryamā /
column2: Favour us Mitra, Varuna, and Vishnu, and Prajāpati! Gracious• to us be Indra and Brihaspati and Aryaman.

column1: śam naḥ mitraḥ śam varuṇaḥ śam vivasvān cham antakaḥ / utpātāḥ pārthiva antarikṣāḥ śam naḥ divicarāḥ grahāḥ /
column2: Favour us Mitra, Varuna, Vivasvān, and the Finisher, Portents on earth and in the air, and planets wandering in heaven!

column1: śam naḥ bhūmiḥ vepyamānā śam ulkā nirhatam ca yat / śam gāvaḥ lohita kṣīrāḥ śam bhūmiḥ ava tīryatīḥ /
column2: Gracious to us be trembling earth, gracious the flaming meteor stroke! Gracious be kine who yield red milk, gracious be earth when sinking down!

column1: nakṣatram ulkā abhihatam śam astu naḥ śam naḥ abhicārāḥ śam u santu kṛtyāḥ / śam naḥ nikhātāḥ valgāḥ śam ulkāḥ deśa upasargāḥ śam u naḥ bhavantu /
column2: Gracious be meteor-stricken constellation, gracious to us be magic spells and witchcraft! Gracious to us be buried charms, and gracious the meteors and the portents of the region!

column1: śam naḥ grahāḥ cāndramasāḥ śam ādityaḥ ca rāhuṇā / śam naḥ mṛtyuḥ dhūmaketuḥ śam rudrāḥ tigma tejasaḥ /
column2: Kind be the Powers who seize the Moon, with Rāhu be Ādityas kind! Favour us Death and Cornet, and Rudras with penetrating. might!

column1: śam rudrāḥ śam vasavaḥ śam ādityāḥ śam agnayaḥ / śam naḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ devāḥ śam devāḥ śam bṛhaspatiḥ //
column2: Rudras and Vasus favour us, Ādityas, Agnis favour us! Favour us mighty Rishis, Gods, Goddesses, and Brihaspati!

column1: brahma prajāpatiḥ dhātā lokāḥ vedāḥ sapta ṛṣayaḥ agnayaḥ / taiḥ me kṛtam svastyayanam indraḥ me śarma yacchatu brahmā me śarma yacchatu / viśve me devāḥ śarma yacchantu sarve me devāḥ śarma yacchantu / yāni kāni cit śāntāni loke sapta ṛṣayaḥ viduḥ / sarvāṇi śam bhavantu me śam me astu abhayam me astu //
column2: Brahma, Dhātar, Prajāpati, Worlds, Vedas, Agnis, Rishis Seven. All these have blessed my happy way. May Indra be my guardian, may Brahmā protect and shelter me. May all the Gods protect me, may the Gods united shield me well. May all alleviations in the world which the Seven Rishis know. Be kind and gracious unto me. Bliss and security be mine!

column1: śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntibhiḥ / yat iha ghoram yat iha krūram yat iha pāpam tat śāntam tat śivam sarvam eva śam astu naḥ //
column2: Earth alleviation, air alleviation, heaven alleviation, waters alleviation, plants alleviation, trees alleviation, all Gods my al- leviation, collective Gods my alleviation, alleviation by allevia- tions. By these alleviations, these universal alleviations, I allay all that is terrific here, all that is cruel, all that is wicked. This hath been calmed, this is now auspicious. Let all be favourable to us.

column1: śam naḥ indra agnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śam naḥ indrāvaruṇā rāta havyā / śam indrāsomā suvitāya śam yoḥ śam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau /
column2: Befriend us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuna who receive oblations! Indra and Soma give health, wealth and comfort, Indra and Pūshan be our strength in battle!

column1: śam naḥ bhagaḥ śam u naḥ śaṃsaḥ astu śam naḥ puraṃdhiḥ śam u santu rāyaḥ / śam naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṃsaḥ śam naḥ aryamā puru jātaḥ astu /
column2: Auspicious friends to us be Bhaga. Sansa, auspicious be Pur- andhi and all Riches, The blessing of the true and well-conducted and Aryaman in many forms apparent.

column1: śam naḥ dhātā śam u dhartā naḥ astu śam naḥ urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ / śam rodasī bṛhatī śam naḥ adriḥ śam naḥ devānām su havāni santu //
column2: Kind unto us be Maker and Sustainer and the far-reaching One with godlike nature. Auspicious unto us be Earth and Heaven, the Mountain and the Gods' fair invocations.

column1: śam naḥ agniḥ jyotiḥ anīkaḥ astu śam naḥ mitrāvaruṇau aśvinā śam / śam naḥ su kṛtām su kṛtāni santu śam naḥ iṣiraḥ abhi vātu vātaḥ /
column2: Favour us Agni with his face of splendour, and Varuna and' Mitra and the Asvins. Favour us noble actions of the pious; impetuous Vāta blow on, us with favour!

column1: śam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī pūrva hūtau śam antarikṣam dṛśaye naḥ astu / śam naḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ rajasaḥ patiḥ astu jiṣṇuḥ /
column2: Early invoked may Heaven and Earth be friendly, and Air's mid-region good for us to look on. To us may herbs and forest trees be gracious, gracious the Lord victorious of the region.

column1: śam naḥ indraḥ vasubhiḥ devaḥ astu śam ādityebhiḥ varuṇaḥ su śaṃsaḥ / śam naḥ rudraḥ rudrebhiḥ jalāṣaḥ śam naḥ tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ iha śṛṇotu //
column2: Be the God Indra with the Vasus friendly, and with Ādityas Varuna who blesseth. Kind with the Rudras be the healer Rudra, and with the Dames here Tvashtar kindly hear us.

column1: śam naḥ somaḥ bhavatu brahma śam naḥ śam naḥ grāvāṇaḥ śam u santu yajñāḥ / śam naḥ svarūnām mitayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ prasvaḥ śam u astu vediḥ /
column2: Kind unto us be Soma and Devotions, kind be the sacrifice and Stones for pressing. Kind be the fixing of the Sacred Pillars, kind be the tender Grass, and kind the Altar.

column1: śam naḥ sūryaḥ uru cakṣāḥ ud etu śam naḥ bhavantu pradiśaḥ catasraḥ / śam naḥ parvatāḥ dhruvayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ sindhavaḥ śam u santu āpaḥ /
column2: May the far-seeing Sun rise up to bless us: be the four quarters- of the heaven auspicious. Auspicious be the firmly-seated Mountains, auspicious be the Rivers and the Waters.

column1: śam naḥ aditiḥ bhavatu vratebhiḥ śam naḥ bhavantu marutaḥ su arkāḥ / śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā naḥ astu śam naḥ bhavitram śam u astu vāyuḥ //
column2: May Aditi through holy works be gracious, and may the Maruts,_ loud in song, be friendly. May Vishnu give felicity, and, Pūshan, and Air that cherisheth. our lives, and Vāyu.

column1: śam naḥ devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavantu uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ / śam naḥ parjanyaḥ bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śam naḥ kṣetrasya patiḥ astu śaṃbhuḥ /
column2: Prosper us Savitar, the God who rescues, and let the radiant. Mornings be propitious. Propitious to our children be Pārjanya, kind to us be the field's benign Protector!

column1: śam naḥ satyasya patayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ arvantaḥ śam u santu gāvaḥ / śam naḥ ṛbhavaḥ su kṛtaḥ su hastāḥ śam naḥ bhavatu pitaraḥ haveṣu //
column2: May the great Lords of Truth protect and aid us: blest to us be our horses and our cattle. Kind be the pious, skilful-handed Ribhus, kind be the Fathers at our invocations

column1: śam naḥ devāḥ viśva devāḥ bhavantu śam sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ astu / śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śam naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śam naḥ apyāḥ /
column2: Kind to us be the Gods and Visve Devas, Sarasvati with Holy Thoughts be gracious. Friendly be they, the Liberal Ones, who seek us, yea, those who dwell in-heaven, on earth, in waters.

column1: śam naḥ ajaḥ ekapād devaḥ astu śam ahiḥ budhnyaḥ śam samudraḥ / śam naḥ apām napāt peruḥ astu śam naḥ pṛṣṇiḥ bhavatu deva gopā /
column2: May Aja-Ekapād the God be gracious, gracious the Dragon of the Deep, and Ocean. Gracious be he, the swelling Child of Waters, gracious be Prisni who hath Gods to guard her.

column1: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ juṣantām idam brahma kriyamāṇam navīyaḥ / sṛṇvantu naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāsaḥ go jātāḥ uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ /
column2: So may the Rudras, Vasus, and Ādityas accept the new hymn we now are making. May all the Holy Ones of earth and heaven, and the Cow's off- spring hear our invocation.

column1: ye devānām ṛtvijaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ manoḥ yajatrāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ / te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ /
column2: Priests of the Gods, worthy of sacrifices, immortal, knowing Law, whom man must worship. May these to-day give us broad paths to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

column1: uṣāḥ apa svasuḥ tamaḥ sam vartayati vartanim su jāta tā / ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ /
column2: Dawn drives away her sister's gloom, and through her excellence makes her retrace her path. Through her may we gain God-appointed treasure, and with brave sons be glad through hundred winters.

column1: indrasya bāhū sthavirau vṛṣāṇau citrāḥ imāḥ vṛṣabhau pārayiṣṇū / tau yokṣe prathamaḥ yogaḥ āgate yābhyām jitam asurāṇām svar yat /
column2: These the two sturdy, manly arms of Indra, these that are won- drous, mighty, and successful First, when the need hath come will I employ them by which the heaven of Asuras was conquered.

column1: āśuḥ śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ carṣaṇīnām / saṃkrandanaḥ animiṣaḥ eka vīraḥ śatam senāḥ ajayat sākam indraḥ /
column2: Swift, like a dread bull sharpening his weapons, rapidly striking, stirring up the people, Loud shouting, vigilant, the one sole Hero, Indra subdued a hundred hosts together.

column1: saṃkrandanena animiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā āyodhyena duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā / tat indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvam yudhaḥ naraḥ iṣu hastena vṛṣṇā /
column2: With him loud-roaring, ever watchful, victor bold, hard to over- throw, whom none may vanquish, Indra the strong whose hand bears arrows, conquer, ye heroes now, now vanquish in the combat.

column1: saḥ iṣu hastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhiḥ vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaḥ indraḥ gaṇena / saṃsṛṣṭa jit soma pāḥ bāhu śardhī ugra dhanvā pratihitābhiḥ astā /
column2: He rules with those who carry shafts and quivers, Indra who with his hand brings hosts together, Foe-conquering, strong of arm, the Soma-drinker, with mighty bow, shooting with well-laid arrows.

column1: bala vijñāyaḥ sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ / abhivīraḥ abhiṣatvā sahaḥ jit jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha go vidam / imam vīram anu harṣadhvam ugram indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam / grāma jitam go jitam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā /
column2: Conspicuous by thy strength, firm, foremost fighter, mighty and fierce, victorious, all-subduing, O'ercoming might, excelling men and heroes, mount the kine- winning conquering car, O Indra. Troop-vanquisher, kine-winner, armed with thunder, who quells an army and with might destroys it, Follow him, comrades! quit yourselves like heroes, and like this Indra show your zeal and courage.

column1: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamānaḥ adāyaḥ ugraḥ śatamanyuḥ indraḥ / duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāh ayodhyaḥ asmākam senāḥ avatu pra yutsu //
column2: Piercing the cow-stalls with surpassing vigour, Indra the pitiless hero, wild with anger, Victor in fight, unshaken and resistless,—may he protect our armies in our battles.

column1: bṛhaspate pari dīya rathena rakṣaḥ hā amitrām apabādhamānaḥ / prabhañjam śatrūn pramṛṇan amitrān asmākam edhi avitā tanūnām /
column2: Brihaspati, fly with thy chariot hither, slayer of demons, driving. off our foemen. Be thou protector of our bodies, crushing our enemies, destroy- ing those who hate us.

column1: indraḥ eṣām netā bṛhaspatiḥ dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ puras etu somaḥ / deva senānām abhibhañjatīnām jayantīnām marutaḥ yantu madhye /
column2: Indra guide these! Brihaspati, the Guerdon, and Soma, and the Sacrifice precede them! And let the banded Maruts march in forefront of heavenly hosts that conquer and demolish.

column1: indrasya vṛṣṇaḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ ādityānām marutām śardhaḥ ugram / mahāmanasām bhuvana cyavānām ghoṣaḥ devānām jayatām ud asthāt /
column2: Ours be the potent host of mighty Indra, King Varuna, and Maruts and Ādityas. Uplifted is the shout of Gods who conquer, high-minded God who cause the world to tremble.

column1: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tāḥ jayantu / asmākam vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmān devāsaḥ avata haveṣu /
column2: May Indra aid us when our flags are gathered: victorious be th arrows of our army. May our brave men of war prevail in battle. Ye Gods, protect u in the shouts of onset.

column1: idam ucchreyaḥ avasānam āgām śive me dyāvāpṛthivī abhūtām / asapatnāḥ pradiśaḥ me bhavantu na vai tvā dviṣmaḥ abhayam naḥ astu /
column2: I have attained this goodliest place to rest in. Both Heaven and, Earth have shown me grace and favour. Without a foe for me be all the regions! We hate thee not. May we have peace and safety.

column1: yatas indra bhayāmahe tatas naḥ abhayam kṛdhi / maghavam chagdhi tava tvam naḥ ūtibhiḥ vi dviṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi //
column2: Indra, give us security from that whereof we are afraid. Help us, O Maghavan, let thy succour grant us this: drive foes and enemies afar.

column1: indram vayam anūrādham havāmahe anu rādhyāsma dvipadā catuṣpadā / mā naḥ senāḥ araruṣīḥ upa guḥ viṣūciḥ indra druhaḥ vi nāśaya //
column2: We call on Indra, on the liberal giver: we will be prosperous in men and cattle. Let not the hosts of cruel fiends approach us. Drive of the Druhs to every side, O Indra.

column1: indraḥ trātā uta vṛtra hā para sphānaḥ vareṇyaḥ / sa rakṣitā caramatas sa madhyatas sa paścāt sa purastāt naḥ astu /
column2: Best, making household wealth increase. Indra our saviour, kills the foe. May he from outmost point be our potector, and from the centre and from west and eastward.

column1: urum naḥ lokam anu neṣi vidvān svar yat jyotiḥ abhayam svasti / ugrā te indra sthavirasya bāhū upa kṣayema śaraṇā bṛhantā /
column2: Lead us to ample room. O thou who knowest, to happiness security, and sunlight. Strong, Indra, are the arms of thee the mighty: may we betake us to their lofty shelter.

column1: abhayam naḥ karati antarikṣam abhayam dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime / abhayam paścāt abhayam purastāt uttarāt adharāt abhayam naḥ astu /
column2: May air's mid-region give us peace and safety, safety may both these, Heaven and Earth, afford us. Security be ours from west, from eastward, from north and south may we be free from danger.

column1: abhayam mitrāt abhayam amitrāt abhayam jñātāt abhayam puras yaḥ / abhayam naktam abhayam divā naḥ sarvāḥ āśāḥ mama mitram bhavantu //
column2: Safety be ours from friend and from the unfriendly, safety from what we know and what we know not. Safety be ours by night and in the day-time! friendly to me be all my hopes and wishes!

column1: asapatnam purastāt paścāt naḥ abhayam kṛtam / savitā mā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt mā śacīpatiḥ /
column2: Peace hath been given us from the east, and from the west security. Savitar guard me from the south, and from the north the Lord of Might.

column1: divaḥ me ādityāḥ rakṣatu bhūmyāḥ rakṣantu agnayaḥ / indra agnī rakṣatām mā purastāt aśvinau abhitas śarma yacchatām / tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedāḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ me sarvatas santu varma /
column2: May the Ādityas from the sky protect me, Agni from the earth. May Indra-Agni guard me from the eastward, on all sides may the Asvins give me shelter. May Jātavedas guard, sidelong, our cattle. Our shield on all sides be the World-Creators!

column1: agniḥ mā pātu vasubhiḥ purastāt tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā / vāyuḥ mā antarikṣeṇa etasyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: Agni from eastward guard me with the Vasus! To him I go, in him I rest: this fort I seek for refuge. May he protect me, may he be my guardian. I give my soul—All hail! into his keeping. Vāyu with Air protect me from this region. To him I go, etc.

column1: somaḥ mā rudraiḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: May Soma from the south, with Rudras, guard me. To him, etc.

column1: varuṇaḥ mā ādityaiḥ etasyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: Varuna with Ādityas guard me from this region! To him etc.

column1: sūryaḥ mā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: Sūrya with Earth and Heaven from the western region guard me well. To him, etc.

column1: āpaḥ mā oṣadhīmatīḥ etasyāḥ diśaḥ pāntu tāsu krame tāsu śraye tām puram praimi / tāḥ mā rakṣantu tāḥ mā gopāyantu tābhyaḥ ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: May Waters joined with Plants protect me from this region. To them I go, in them I rest: this fort I seek for refuge. May they protect me, may they be my guardians. I give my soul—All hail! —into their keeping.

column1: viśvakarmā mā sapta ṛṣibhiḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: May Visvakarman with the Seven Rishis be my protector from the northern region. To him, etc.

column1: indraḥ mā marutvān etasyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: May Indra, Marut-girt, protect me from this region. To him, etc.

column1: prajāpatiḥ mā prajananavān saha pratiṣṭhayā dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā / bṛhaspatiḥ mā viśvaiḥ devaiḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmim śraye tām puram praimi / sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā /
column2: Prajāpati, of generative power, with the Pratishlhā save me from the nadir! To him, etc. Brihaspati, joined by the Visvedevas, protect me from the region of the zenith! To him, I go, in him I rest; this fort I seek for refuge. May he protect me, may he be my guardian. I give my soul— All hail!—into his keeping.

column1: agnim te vasuvantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ prācyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from the eastern region, sinners, praise Agni followed by the Vasus.

column1: vāyum te antarikṣavantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ etasyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from this quarter, sinners, praise Vāyu compassed by the Air's mid region.

column1: somam te rudravantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from the southern quarter, sinners, sing praise to Soma with the Rudras.

column1: varuṇam te ādityavantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ etasyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from this quarter, sinners, praise Varuna connected with Ādityas.

column1: sūryam te dyāvāpṛthivīvantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyava pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān / apaḥ te oṣadhīmatīḥ ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ etasyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from the western quarter, sinners, praise Sūrya linked with Earth and Heaven. Let those who vex me from this quarter, sinners give praise to plants' associates the Waters.

column1: viśvakarmāṇam te sapta ṛṣivantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who from the north side vex me, sinners, praise Visvakarman with the Seven Rishis.

column1: indram te marutvantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ etasyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from this quarter, sinners, praise Indra with the Marut host about him.

column1: prajāpatim te prajananavantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from the nadir, sinners, extol Prajāpati of genial power.

column1: bṛhaspatim te viśvadevavantam ṛchantu / ye māghāyavaḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsān /
column2: Let those who vex me from the zenith, sinners, extol Brihaspati with the Visve Devas.

column1: mitraḥ pṛthivyāḥ ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Mitra arose with Earth. To that fort I lead you: enter it, occupy it. Let it give you protection and defence.

column1: vāyuḥ antarikṣeṇa ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Vāyu arose with Air. To that fort, etc.

column1: sūryaḥ divā ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Sūrya arose with Heaven. To that fort, etc. Chandramās arose with the Constellation. To that fort, etc.

column1: yajñaḥ dakṣiṇābhiḥ ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Sacrifice arose with Priestly Fees. To that fort, etc.

column1: samudraḥ nadībhiḥ ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Ocean arose with the Rivers. To that fort, etc.

column1: brahma brahmacāribhiḥ ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Brahma arose with the Brahmachārīs. To that fort, etc.

column1: indraḥ vīryeṇa ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Indra arose with Might. To that fort, etc.

column1: devāḥ amṛtena ud akrāman tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: The Gods arose with Immortality. To that fort, etc.

column1: prajāpatiḥ prajābhiḥ ud akrāmat tām puram pra nayāmi vaḥ / tām ā viśata tām pra viśata sā vaḥ śarma ca varma ca yacchatu //
column2: Prajāpati arose with Creatures. To that fort I lead you: enter it, occupy it give you protection and defence.

column1: apa nyadhuḥ pauruṣeyam vadham yam indra agnī dhātā savitā bṛhaspatiḥ / somaḥ rājā varuṇaḥ aśvinā yamaḥ pūṣā asmān pari pātu mṛtyoḥ /
column2: May Soma, Varuna the King, both Asvins, Yama and Pūshan guard us well from Mrityu— Death caused by men, which Indra-Agni, Dhātar, Brihaspati and Savitar appointed.

column1: yāni cakāra bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ prajāpatiḥ mātariśvā prajābhyaḥ / pradiśaḥ yāni vasate diśaḥ ca tāni me varmāṇi bahulāni santu /
column2: All that the World's Lord made, all that for creatures Prajāpati and Mātarisvan fashioned, All things within the quarters and their spaces, let all these be my manifold defences.

column1: yat te tanūṣu anahyanta devāḥ dyurājayaḥ dehinaḥ / indraḥ yat cakre varma tat asmān pātu viśvatas /
column2: That which the Gods bound on them when they battled for their royal sway. What Indra made his shield, may that protect us well on every side,

column1: varma me dyāvāpṛthivī varma ahar varma sūryaḥ / varma me viśve devāḥ kran mā mā prāpat pratīcikā /
column2: My shield is Heaven and Earth, my shield is the bright Day, my shield the Sun. The Visva Devas made my shield. Let not misfortune fall on me.

column1: gāyatrī uṣṇih anuṣṭubh bṛhatī paṅktiḥ triṣṭubh jagatyai //
column2: Gāyatri, Ushnih, Anushtup, Brihatī, Trishtup, Jagatī.

column1: āṅgirasānām ādyaiḥ pañca anuvākaiḥ svāhā //
column2: With the first five chapters of the Angirases, Hail!

column1: ṣaṣṭhāya svāhā //
column2: To the sixth, Hail!

column1: saptama aṣṭamābhyām svāhā //
column2: To the seventh and eight, Hail!

column1: nīla nakhebhyaḥ svāhā // haritebhyaḥ svāhā // kṣudrebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: The black-clawed ones, Hail! To the golden-hued ones, Hail! To the small ones, Hail!

column1: paryāyikebhyaḥ svāhā // prathamebhyaḥ śaṅkhebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: To those composed in strophes, Hail! To the first shells, Hail!

column1: dvitīyebhyaḥ śaṅkhebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: To the second shells, Hail!

column1: tṛtīyebhyaḥ śaṅkhebhyaḥ svāhā // upottamebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: To the third shells, Hail! To the penultimates, Hail.

column1: uttamebhyaḥ svāhā // uttarebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: To the last ones, Hail! To the latter ones, Hail!

column1: ṛṣibhyaḥ svāhā // śikhibhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: To the Rishis, Hail! To those with hair in tufts, Hail!

column1: gaṇebhyaḥ svāhā // mahā gaṇebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: To the Ganas, Hail! To the great Ganas, Hail!

column1: sarvebhyaḥ aṅgirobhyaḥ vida gaṇebhyaḥ svāhā // pṛthak sahasrābhyām svāhā //
column2: To all the Vidagana Angirases, Hail! To those two with separate thousands, Hail!

column1: brahmaṇe svāhā //
column2: To Brahma, Hail!

column1: brahma jyeṣṭhā sambhṛtā viryāṇi brahma agre jyeṣṭham divam ā tatāna / bhūtānām brahmā prathamā uta jajñe tena arhati brahmaṇā spardhitum kaḥ /
column2: Collected manly powers are topped by Brahma. Brahma at first spread out the loftiest heaven. Brahma was born first of all things existing. Who then is meet to be that Brahma's rival?

column1: ātharvaṇānām catur ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the four-verse strophes of the Atharvanas!

column1: pañca ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the five-versed!

column1: ṣaṣ ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the six-versed!

column1: sapta ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the seven-versed!

column1: aṣṭa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the eight-versed!

column1: nava ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the nine-versed!

column1: daśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā // ekādaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the ten-versed! Hail to the eleven-versed!

column1: dvādaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā // trayodaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the twelve-versed! Hail to the thirteen-versed

column1: caturdaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the fourteen-versed!

column1: pañcadaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the fifteen-versed!

column1: ṣoḍaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the sixteen-versed!

column1: saptadaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the seventeen-versed!

column1: aṣṭādaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the eighteen-versed!

column1: ekonaviṃśatiḥ svāhā // viṃśatiḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail, nineteen! Hail, twenty!

column1: mahatkāṇḍāya svāhā //
column2: Hail to the Great Section!

column1: tṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the triplets!

column1: eka ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the single-versed hymns!

column1: kṣudrebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the little ones!

column1: eka anṛcebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the single non-Rich-versed ones!

column1: rohitebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the Rohitas!

column1: sūryābhyām svāhā // vrātyābhyām svāhā //
column2: Hail to the two Sūryā hymns! Hail to the two Vrātya hymns!

column1: prājāpatyābhyām svāhā // viṣāsahyai svāhā // maṅgalikebhyaḥ svāhā //
column2: Hail to the two Prajāpati hymns! Hail to the hymn of victory!

column1: brahmaṇe svāhā //
column2: Hail to Brahma!

column1: brahma jyeṣṭhā saṃbhṛtā vīryāṇi brahma agre jyeṣṭham divam ā tatāna / bhūtānām brahmā prathamā uta jajñe tena arhati brahmaṇā spardhitum kaḥ /
column2: Collected manly powers are topped by Brahma. Brahma at first spread out the loftiest heaven. Brahma was born first of all things existing. Who then is fit to be this Brahma's rival?

column1: yena devam savitāram pari devāḥ adhārayan / tena imam brahmaṇas pate pari rāṣṭrāya dhattana //
column2: Do ye, O Brāhmanaspati, invest for the royal sway this man. With that wherewith the Deities invested Savitar the God.

column1: pari imam indram āyuṣe mahe kṣatrāya dhattana / yathā enam jarase nayāt jyok kṣatre adhi jāgarat / pari imam indram āyuṣe mahe śrotrāya dhattana / yathā enam jarase nayāt jyok śrotre adhi jāgarat //
column2: Invest this Indra for long life, invest him for great princely power, That I may lead him on to eld, that the man watch his princedom long. Invest this Soma for long life, invest him for great hearing power. That I may lead him on to eld, that he may watch o'er hearing long.

column1: pari dhatta dhatta naḥ varcasā imam jarā mṛtyum kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ / bṛhaspatiḥ prāyacchat vāsaḥ etat somāya rājñe paridhātavai u //
column2: For us, surround him, cover him with splendour, give him long life, and death when age removes him. This garment hath Brihaspati presented to Soma, to the King, to wrap about him.

column1: jarām su gaccha pari dhatsva vāsaḥ bhava gṛṣṭīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u / śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaḥ ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva // pari idam vāsaḥ adhithāḥ svastaye abhūḥ vāpīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u / śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcīḥ vasūni cāruḥ vi bhajāsi jīvan /
column2: Advance to good old age: endue the mantle. Be thou our heifers' guard from imprecation. Live thou a hundred full and plenteous autumns, and wrap thee in prosperity of riches. Thou for weal hast clothed thee in this garment: thou hast become our cows' sure guard from curses. Live thou a hundred full and plenteous autumns: then living, fair thyself, shalt deal forth treasures.
